She sees herself as a very hardworking woman who has sacrificed a lot.  She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of more chickens to continue selling rotisserie chicken, which will allow her to continue working and striving for her family.

loans.use: purchase chickens to sell.

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
El Sr. Anibal tiene un hijo adolescente y es viudo hace 4 años, el tiene una herrería desde el año 1997 en su domicilio en la ciudad de  Villa Elisa.
Tiene una clientela formada, y el crédito  solicitado de la Fundación Paraguaya desea invertirlo para poder mejorar  su Stock de hierros y de esa forma, cumplir con todos los pedidos de sus clientes. El es un hombre muy trabajador, que por medio de su trabajo ha podido sacar adelante a su familia.
Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Anibal lives in the town of Villa Elisa and works at the hardware business he opened in 1997 out of his home. He is a widower and is now the single father to his teenage son. Anibal is a very hardworking man who is dedicated to his family, and he does everything he can to provide for them. 

With the support from this loan, Anibal plans to purchase various metals and tools to stock his hardware business. He hopes that this investment will help him to keep up with client orders and offer a wider variety of products to his clients. Anibal is very grateful for this opportunity and hopes it will have a positive effect on his business.

loans.use: to purchase tools and metal to stock his hardware business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 35-year-old businesswoman from Liberia. She is married and has five children aged between 4 and 19; only four are in school, and they all live at home. She describes herself as hardworking.

She lives in Nimba, a county in Liberia that shares a border with Guinea and Cote D’Ivoire.  Because of its status as a border county, trade is the primary activity in the region. It also has the second highest population in Liberia. 

Mary has a table-based business from which she has sold rice and cassava for the past 12 years. She works 10 hours at her business. Her greatest challenge in business is few goods in her inventory. She intends to use the loan to buy more rice and cassava for her business. She started her business with money from her mother. She likes her business because she realizes some profit every time she sells. She hopes to one day move from the table business to a store.  

She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to buy more rice and cassava for her business.

loans.name: Mariyum

texts.en: Mariyum is a 33-year-old lady. She has been operating a beauty parlor for about two years. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her best services, she has become very famous on her street. In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying a bigger variety of cosmetics products for the parlor.  But because of her limited cash on hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for her second loan. She needs a loan of Rs 35,000 to buy hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is hoping to serve to more customers time after time. With the help of the loan, she will be able to generate more income that will help her in meeting her household expenditures.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Nazir

texts.ru: Назир – это тот человек, которым мы все должны гордиться. Он из скромного района Кубодиён. Назир верный муж, прекрасный отец и просто 73-летний дедушка, который живет полной жизнью и благодарит Бога за каждый прожитый день. У него только два сына, которые помогают ему по хозяйству, пару голов скота и маленький участок для животноводства и растениеводства. И ему этого достаточно для полного счастья. Назир радуется жизни и заряжает своей радостью других и учит их благодарить за то что у них есть. Он с юных лет любил разводить скот и выращивать овощи и фрукты на своем участке. Назир просит кредит для приобретения пару голов крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить свое хозяйство.
texts.en:
Nazir is the kind of person we should all admire. He is from the humble region of Qubadiyon. Nazir is a faithful husband, good father and simply a 73 year old grandfather who lives life to the full and thanks God for every passing day. He only has two sons, who help him with his farm which has a couple of heads of cattle and a small plot of land for livestock breeding and crop production. For him this is enough for complete happiness. 

Nazir enjoys life and his joy energizes others and teaches them thankfulness for what they have. Since his young years, Nazir loved breeding cattle and growing vegetables and fruit on his land. Nazir requests a loan to purchase a couple of heads of cattle, in order to develop his business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for reselling

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of dried fish to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Benter

texts.en:
Benter is a 41-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as a perfectionist. She operates a food stall where she sells cereals and other items. 

She will use the 15,600 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy a water tank to store clean water. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to take up a business loan. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store clean water.

loans.name: Rowaida

texts.en: Rowaida is a 36-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and only child. Her husband works at a local institution. As for her, she has worked as an architectural designer since 1998. Her work is specialized in making interior design drawings and illustrations to precise companies and clients. She works on a freelance basis and her job is based at her home. Today, Rowaida is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to enlarge her operations by purchasing needed supplies such as maps, charts, documents, etc.  Rowaida’s only purpose is to earn enough income to be able to support her family well financially.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as maps, charts and documents

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 32-year-old, married woman and a mother of five children. 

For about eight years, she has been involved in the business of milk sales. By now, she has become famous in her community for selling good quality milk. She has a good client list and is able to manage her household expenses. 

To increase her sales, Zahida needs to purchase another cow. For this reason, she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She expects a boost her in her earnings through her greater sales. 

Zahida dreams for her children's bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Muhamed

texts.en:
Muhamed is a 30-year-old married man and a father of two children. He has been working in the agriculture sector for seven years. Muhamed is a hard worker and he has four employees. He is specialized in growing palm trees and selling dates. Muhamed takes good care of his production and makes sure that every tree has the care it needs to ensure high-quality production.

Muhamed is requesting a loan of 2,500 USD. He will use this loan to purchase organic fertilizers and renovate his farm. Muhamed expects that the loan will generate additional income that will enable him to buy livestock and develop his farm.

The story of Muhamed and his business is just one of the many examples from Izdiharona for Economic Development where clients have been able to improve their business with a small business loan product, specifically designed to meet the needs of small business where a relatively small capital can provide significant business improvement.

loans.use: to buy necessary organic fertilizers and renovate his farm.

loans.name: Paridakhan

texts.ru: Паридахан 39 лет, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей. Супруг находится на заработках в России, ежемесячно высылает свою зарплату. Паридахан и ее старшая дочь работают швеями. Паридахан в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Паридахан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 1 телка, 7 овец, а также 0,73 ГА земельной доли на которой выращивает хлопок. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Паридахан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки 2 голов крупного рогатого скота. Доходы от кредита Паридахан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Paridakhan is 39 years old, married and raising two children. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia, and every month he sends his salary home. Paridakhan and her eldest daughter work with sewing. 

As additional income for her family, Paridakhan works with livestock breeding and crop cultivation. Thanks to Paridakhan's persistent work, her farm currently consists of one dairy cow, one calf, one heifer, seven sheep and also 0.73 hectares of land on which she grows cotton. The monthly income is 5,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Paridakhan turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for increasing the number of livestock through purchasing two heads of cattle. Paridakhan plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 23-year-old married man and a father of one child. He has been working in the agriculture sector for five years. Ali is a professional worker; he is specialized in growing palm trees and selling dates. Ali takes good care of his production and makes sure that every tree has the care it needs to ensure high-quality production.

Ali is requesting a loan of 2,200 USD. He will use this loan to purchase organic fertilizers and a water pump.  Ali expects that the loan will generate additional income that will enable him to replace the current open channel with drip irrigation system. 

The story of Ali and his business is just one of the many examples from Izdiharona for Economic Development of clients who have been able to improve their business with a small business loan product, specifically designed to meet the needs of small business where a relatively small capital can provide significant business improvement.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers and a water pump.

loans.name: Gona's Group

texts.en:
Gona is a member of this group from Iraq. Gona is 41 years old, married and has four children. She is one of the many Iraqi women who are working from home, using her sewing skills to generate additional income and contribute to meeting the financial needs of her family. She has six years of experience with her home-based sewing business activity and to improve the quality of the services to her customers as well as improve her work conditions she would like to buy a new sewing machine, table and fabric.

Gona has a very good reputation in her neighborhood, with her special talent and the customer service she provides. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits so that she may open a bigger business location and continue assisting her husband by getting additional income and providing a better life for her children.

The story of Gona and her business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona’s clients who have been able to improve their business with a small business loan product, specifically designed to meet the needs of small business where a relatively small capital can provide significant business improvement.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, table and fabric.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is a small-scale petty trader who sells footwear, ladies wear, underwear and bags in Ebubonku (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education, as she is a secondary school graduate. She is married and has one child.  Her husband is a clerk, and she has been working as a petty trader for close to seven years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. 

She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of  footwear, ladies wear, underwear and bags, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a shop, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of footwear, ladies wear, underwear and bags, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand.

loans.name: Ghulam  Zainab

texts.en:
Ghulam Zainab is a 22-year-old single lady. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. 

To cope with the increasing demands of her customers she has requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase more reels of threads with packs of buttons, zippers, and laces in various colors. In this way she will be able to stitch up more dresses. 

She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads with packs of buttons, zippers, and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Bibiane

texts.en:
Bibiane is a 41-year-old married woman. She has 8 children with ages ranging from 13 years to 19 years. She describes herself as business minded. 

She will use the KES 26,500 loan to buy a 4000 litre tank for water storage that will benefit 13 people. They will be able to store clean water for domestic use. 

She hopes that in the future she will be a wholesaler. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a 4,000 litre water tank.

loans.name: Astar

texts.en:
Astar is 31 years old, married, and the mother of two children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Astar has applied for a loan of Rs 25,000 for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. 

Astar is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Ana Delfina

texts.en:
Ana Delfina (pictured working with her daughter and son) is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story.

Hello. My name is Ana. I am 42 years old and married with three kids. I have been working in retail for the last twenty years. I used to sell groceries and electrical appliances in flea markets, and five years ago, I opened my own grocery store. I like to provide good services and low prices to my clients.

I will use the loan to increase my inventory. I will buy groceries, canned goods, sodas and other products that I sell pretty well. By having more inventory, I will be able to increase my sales.

I consider myself a hardworking and credit-worthy person. My biggest accomplishment is providing a good life for my kids and being able to improve my house over time.

loans.use: To buy inventory such as groceries, canned goods, and sodas

loans.name: Noor's Group

texts.en:
Noor is a member of this group from Iraq. Noor is 33 years old, married and has three children. She is one of the many Iraqi women who have her own business. Noor has a cosmetics shop. She is working hard to generate additional income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has three years of experience in this business and wants to add brand names to attract more customers by offering a bigger selection of products. Noor has a very good reputation in her area and is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits so that she can open a bigger place in the future and continue assisting her husband with additional income and providing better life for her children.

The story of Noor and her business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona’s clients who have been able to improve their business with a small business loan product, specifically designed to meet the needs of small business where a relatively small capital can provide significant business improvement.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Mazen

texts.en:
Mazen is a 19-year-old single Iraqi man who lives with his parents. He is a smart, dedicated student who plans to go to university after finishing high-school. 

In the past he had to work after school to save money for his school tuition and expenses. Now he can focus on his studies and only work on the weekends to pay back the loan. He is requesting a loan of an amount of 3,000 US dollars to pay for his his tuition fees and other school expenses.

The story of Mazen is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for Economic Development clients that are able to get a better education.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees and school expenses.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is widowed and has three children. Two of her children go to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a beauty salon business, and she has been in this business for four months.

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO. She will use the loan to buy more boxes of cream hair relaxer and braids, and a jerrycan of locally-brewed gin.  She works at the market, seven days out of every week.   Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever-increasing prices of cosmetics in Uganda.  She is aspiring to own a bridal salon and to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream hair relaxer and braids, and a jerrycan of locally-brewed gin

loans.name: Soro

texts.ru: Соро 55 лет. Она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Ее муж работает в фермерском хозяйстве. Соро более 20 лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры и фруктовых деревьев. Она имеет большой опыт и введет своё дело отлично. От полученного дохода она сыграла свадьбу своих детей. Построила дом для своего младшего сына и купила машину для старшего сына. Данное время ее дочь серьёзно больна, и ей срочно надо лечиться. Соро данное время не имеет денег, чтобы купить лекарства и лечить свою дочь. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки лекарства. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Soro is 55 years old. She is married and has four children. Her husband works for a farming collective. Soro has been engaged in the cultivation of agriculture and fruit trees for 20 years. She has a lot of experience and has built her business excellently. From the revenue she made she was able to pay for the wedding of her daughter. She also built a house for her youngest son and bought a car for her oldest son. At this time her daughter is seriously ill and needs immediate treatment. Soro doesn't have the money right now to buy medicine and treat her daughter. She is asking for 1,000 Tajikistani Somoni to purchase medicine. She is waiting on your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicine for the treatment of her daughter.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
La Sra. Luz tiene 36 años y tiene una peluquería anexo venta de prendas en su casa. Anteriormente trabajaba en una Peluquería de Asunción por 3 años, donde trabajó y después empezó a trabajar hacia su barrio casa por casa para poder estar cerca de su hijo y no dejarle a otros su cuidado.
Hace 8 años logró su sueño de  tener su propia peluquería en su casa. Ahora su hijo tiene 15 años y su anhelo es darle una vida mejor especialmente en el estudio para que pueda seguir una carrera universitaria.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de jeans, camisas, remeras y de esa forma poder surtir su negocio y seguir ofreciendo una buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luz, 36, has a salon attached to the clothing store in her house. Before, she worked in a salon in Asunción for 3 years. Later, she started to work in her neighborhood door to door to be able to be close to her child and not leave him in the care of others.

8 years ago, she achieved her dream of having her own salon attached to her house. Now her son is 15 and she longs to give him a better life, especially his studies so that he can continue to a university degree.

She is asking for this loan to buy jeans, shirts, t-shirts and the like to be able to stock her business and continue offering a good variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy apparel like jeans, shirts and t-shirts.

loans.name: Santander David

texts.es: David tiene 52 años de edad, es padre de cinco hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Toda su vida ha estado en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agropecuarias y, gracias a ello hoy en día posee diferentes cultivos en una pequeña parcela de su propiedad. Los ingresos para el sustento de su familia, los obtiene de la recolección y venta de la cosecha, que es ofrecida en el mercado del pueblo donde vive. Actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, fertilizantes, fungicidas) para aprovechar los descuentos que le realizan por compras de contado, disminuyendo un poco los costos de los insumos con los que podrá seguir cuidando sus cultivos y sacar una cosecha más productiva, que le permita venderla a mejor precio en el mercado. Así podrá seguir continuando con su labor para que en un futuro cercano pueda ampliar sus cultivos, que le generen mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una estabilidad económica favorable para disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: David, 52 years old, has five children and lives with his partner. He has spent his whole life in the countryside, where he learned farmwork, and today he grows a variety of crops on his small plot of land. He earns an income to support his family from harvesting and selling his crops in the market of the town where he lives. He is currently requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies (manure, fertilizer, fungicides) at wholesale to take advantage of the lower prices and reduce the cost of the supplies. He will use the supplies to cultivate his crops and increase his crop yields, which will allow him sell his crops at a better price at market. That way he can keep working and in the near future expand his crops, generating higher earnings and offering his family economic stability and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies at wholesale (manure, fertilizer, fungicides).

loans.name: Hafeez

texts.en:
Hafeez is a 46-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 15,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 33-year-old married man and a father of six children. He has been working in the agriculture sector for 11 years. Ali is a hard worker; he is specialized in growing palm trees and selling dates. Ali takes good care of his farm and gets the best quality dates in order to have better prices for his production.

Ali is requesting a loan of 2,200 USD. He will use this loan to purchase organic fertilizers and renovate his farm. Ali expects that the loan will generate additional income that will enable him to develop his farm and plant additional palm trees.

The story of Ali and his business is just one of the many examples from Izdiharona for Economic Development of clients who have been able to improve their business with a small business loan product, specifically designed to meet the needs of small business where a relatively small capital can provide significant business improvement.

loans.use: to buy necessary organic fertilizers and renovate his farm.

loans.name: Intisar's Group

texts.en:
Intisar is a member of this group from Iraq. Intisar is 38 years old; married and has three children. She is one of the many Iraqi women who are working from home, using her sewing skills to generate additional income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has seven years of experience with her home-based sewing business. To improve the quality of the services to her customers as well as improve her work conditions she would like to buy a generator and an air conditioner. 

Intisar has a very good reputation in her neighborhood with her special talent and the customer service she provides. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits so that she can continue assisting her husband with the additional income and providing a better life for her children.

The story of Intisar and her business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona clients who have been able to improve their business with a small business loan product, specifically designed to meet the needs of small business where a relatively small capital can provide significant business improvement.

loans.use: to buy a generator and an air conditioner.

loans.name: Zhyan

texts.en:
Zhyan, is a 35-year-old married Iraqi woman. She has three children. Zhyan is an enterprising and energetic woman. She is always looking for opportunities to get ahead, and this is why she is requesting a loan to buy more chickens and a chicken-cleaning machine and to renovate her work place. 

Zhyan started with few chickens, manually cleaning them and selling the meat to the neighbors. Gradually she started saving and buying more chickens. With the increase in demand, she decided to upgrade her business and buy more chickens and a feather-removal machine to reduce the work and keep up with the demand. This will help her generate more income from her sales and support her family.

The story of Zhyan and her business is just one of the many examples from Izdiharona for Economic Development of clients who have been able to improve their business with a small business loan product, specifically designed to meet the needs of small business where a relatively small capital can provide significant business improvement.

loans.use: to buy chickens and a feather-removal machine and to renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.en:
Gulmira is married and has two children who are adults. She always wanted to provide them with good education and since her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, Gulmira decided to start a new café business in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances. 

She studied on the course of ‘To Get Ahead’ run by a women's organization and got the required business skills. She will prepare patties and other kinds of food. She will manage her business alone. 

She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy an oven and a fridge for the new business. She will get through, using her loan and her business will go on to be a source of income, so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy an oven and a fridge so she can organize her café business.

loans.name: Narmina

texts.en:
Narmina is 39 years old. She has three children and she is the main breadwinner in the family. She lives in a village. 

Local people have been busy with animal husbandry and farming. Seventeen years ago, Narmina began to own a business dealing with farming. She grows cattle and poultry and sells animals for meat purposes, milk products and eggs. She works every day from early morning until late evening. She knows her business very well and has great experience. Narmina has been managing the business alone and has her own customers.

She wants to make a present for her daughter. Her daughter is getting married soon and Narmina will buy a dowry of furniture. With this aim, she is asking for a loan of 1,600 AZN to buy furniture. She has many perfect plans for the future and tries to realize them. She awaits your support and mercy.

Narmina appears in the photo together with her uncle.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her daughter

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is married and has two little children. The family lives in Kapan where he makes a living by running a small cafe. Together with his wife he works hard to sustain their business. Due to his friendly attitude and tasty dishes, Armen has gained many loyal customers.
Because Armen’s cafe is very old and needing renovation, he has applied for a 3,000 USD loan through SEF International to help him do so. He wants to be able to provide better service to his clients. Armen hopes for lenders’ support in helping him to improve his cafe and ensure better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of his cafe

loans.name: Bahtir

texts.en:
Bahtir is 62, married and the father of two adult children. He works in a private company fixing doors and other household things. His salary is very low and he is not satisfied with the income that he earns as he is the main source of income for his family. 

Now, he is planning to continue in the same business but he wants to work independently. He has a lot of customers and he is well known for his work in his area. Bahtir is requesting a loan in order to buy  machine for fixing doors, which will allow him to begin to operate independently. He anticipates that his own business will bring him more income than what he currently earns. His goal is to start and then expand his business and eventually employee others. He is very grateful for this opportunity!

loans.use: To buy a working machine

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem is 31 years old and a married woman. She has been running a business of milk sales with her husband, for a period of about six years. She has two cows, one buffalo and two goats. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she and her family make from the milk.  She also is involved in animals sales work, on a seasonal basis, to generate an extra amount of income. She is the mother of three daughters and one son, and she needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures, including food, clothing and education.

In order to make greater profits, she requested a loan of Rs 35,000, which she will use to buy one more buffalo. The animal will increase the milk-producing capacity of Tasleem's herd, which ultimately will help her to increase sales and generate more cash.  This is Tasleem's fourth year with Kashf Foundation, and she has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo for dairy use

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en: Sadia is 25 years old, a married woman, and a mother of two. She has owned a beauty parlor for the past five years. She offers many facilities to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Over time, she has attained a list of regular customers, and she makes enough to contribute to the family income. She needs to deal with more customers, time after time. For this she requires hair care products, skin care products, and creams for bleaching and whitening, in large quantities. So, she applied for a loan of Rs. 25,000 through Kashf Foundation.  She is in her second loan cycle, with a good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction, as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to purchase hair care products, skin care products, and creams for bleaching and whitening, in large quantities

loans.name: Intidhar

texts.en:
Intidhar, is a 46-year-old Iraqi widow. She lost her husband in 2003 and became the sole provider for her child. Intidhar purchased an old sewing machine and has been supporting herself and her child from the income she generates from her work. She has gained an excellent reputation in the neighborhood - thanks to the quality of her work and affordable prices.

Intidhar qualified for Izdiharona’s new loan product (AlQard Elhasan) which is tailored for women who head their household (widows and divorced ladies), and has no interest rate. She received a loan of 500 USD  to replace her old sewing machine which will increase her production and her profits so that she can continue to provide a better life for her child. 

The story of Intidhar and her business is just one of the many examples of IED’s clients who have been able to improve their business with a small business loan product, specifically designed to meet the needs of small business where a relatively small capital can provide significant business improvement.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Candelaria De Dolores

texts.es:
Candelaria, vive con su familia, su hija de 20 años de edad y su yerno de 23 años de edad, su nieta de un año.  Ella, posee una tienda, la cual la tiene en casa y asimismo se dedica a la carpintería, dicha actividad la desempeña de 5:00am hasta las 3:00pm, todos los días. 
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar los productos necesarios tales como: arroz, frijoles, maíz, jabón, bebidas, entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara al fortalecimiento del negocio y a tener más fuerte la tienda.
Su sueño es tener su casa propia y crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Candelaria lives with her family; her 20 year old daughter, 23 years old son in law, and one year old granddaughter.  She has a store in her home and also does carpentry work and works from 5:00 am to 3:00 pm every day.

This loan will allow her to buy necessary products, such as  rice, beans, corn, soap, drinks, and other things.  This will help her strengthen her business and have a better store.

Her dream is to have a house of her own and grow her business.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: John Jairo

texts.es: John es un hombre de 49 años de edad que desde muy joven conoció las actividades del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de su familia. Actualmente y desde hace 7 años posee cultivos de ají, maíz y cebolla cuya producción es vendida para obtener los ingresos que requiere para solventar los gastos y necesidades de su familia, conformada por su esposa y un hijo adolescente. Adicionalmente, labora como mayordomo de una finca, con el interés de complementar la entrada de dinero a su hogar. El cliente es un luchador que se esfuerza y trabaja largas jornadas, sobrepasando distintas adversidades, como por ejemplo, el clima cambiante que afecta sus cultivos, pero siempre avanza con la motivación de cumplir el sueño de ampliar y diversificar sus cultivos, para que le permita ofrecer oportunidades de empleo a otros campesinos del sector. Esto lo lleva a solicitar el crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, riegos y semillas), con lo que le dará continuidad a su  labor y podrá cosechar productos de mejor calidad, que tendrá como resultado el incremento en sus ganancias. De esta manera, John desea tener la capacidad de brindar a su familia un mejor bienestar y estabilidad económica.
texts.en: John is a 49-year-old man who has known how to work the land since he was a very young, thanks to the teachings of his family. Currently and for the last 7 years, he has been growing peppers, corn and onions which he sells in order to provide for his family - a wife and teenage son. John also works as a butler on a ranch to earn extra money. He is industrious and works long days, overcoming various obstacles such as the changing climate and the effect it has on his plants, but he always moves forward with his dream of expanding and diversifying his crops, which will enable him to offer work to other members of his community. It is for this reason he is asking for a loan, which he will invest in buying wholesale agricultural supplies (fertilisers, irrigation equipment and seeds). These will help him continue with his work and obtain a better quality harvest, thereby increasing his earnings. In this way, John hopes to be able to improve his family's wellbeing and economic stability.

loans.use: to buy wholesale agricultural supplies (fertilisers, irrigation equipment and seeds)

loans.name: Malachi

texts.en:
Malachi is a married man. He has seven children with ages ranging from 17 to 30 years. He describes himself as future-oriented. 

He operates a stall where he sells fish and other items to earn a living. He will use the KES 26,500 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water. 

He hopes that in the future, he will expand business and buy his own boat and fishing nets. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water tank to store clean water

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a 41-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has six school-aged children. 

Zenaida toils the land; she grows and sells rice. She has been growing rice for almost five years, and her husband works as a laborer.

To utilize her farm and continue her livelihood activity, Zenaida requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy one sack of fertilizer, a half-sack of rice seedlings, and to pay for a labor fee.

In the future, Zenaida would like to expand her farming business to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy one sack of fertilizer, a half sack of rice seedlings, and to pay for a labor fee

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina, age 41, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a general store for the past six years. She offers a variety of daily use products and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

She is the mother of three children, and is motivated to provide for them with a good standard of living. 

In order to avoid shortages, Zaina needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. Zaina has requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, and juices. With this loan, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings. 

She is in her fifth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, and juices.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Rose who is single and has three children. In 1999, Rose established her corn and cassava dough business. She began her business to take care of her home. Her business is located in her residence and her main customers are all ages and sexes. Working seven days a week and all hours in a day, she earns a very respectable profit. So she is requesting a loan of GHS 1,200 to expand her business. 

Rose needs this loan to buy two bags of maize to grind to dough and sell to customers. She believes this loan will help her increase her profits. 

In the future, Rose plans to expand her trade and hopes to be able to educate her children. She thanks Kiva for the support.

loans.use: To buy two bags of maize to grind to dough to sell to customers.

loans.name: Gemima

texts.es: Gemima, de 37 años, está casada y vive cómodamente en su casa propia en compañía de sus 2 hijos. El trabajo de Gemima consiste en la compra y venta de madera, desde muy temprano sale de su casa a los diferentes puestos de la ciudad en donde busca los mejores trozos de madera para comprarlos y luego llevarlos a realizar el proceso de acabado. El resultado que obtiene son tablas, listones y otros, toda esta actividad lo realiza con ayuda de su esposo, el producto terminado es enviado a sus clientes ubicados otro pueblos cercanos a su localidad. Lleva ya 2 años con este trabajo y esta muy contenta por que le permite tener ganancias económicas satisfactorias para la economía de su hogar. Eventualmente se dedica a la venta de pescados. Al principio era muy complicado para ella realizar este trabajo ya que es muy cansado porque en ocasiones es necesario hacer uso de cierto nivel de fuerza, sin embargo con el tiempo fue acostumbrándose y ahora trabaja sin ninguna dificultad y a un buen ritmo. Espera que su actividad siga en marcha y con mejores resultados. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3500, está agradecida y contenta al saber que sigue contando con el apoyo financiero que necesita para avanzar con el progreso de su negocio. Con el monto solicitado comprará madera para modificarla y posteriormente las enviará a otros pueblos.
texts.en:
Gemima, 37, is married and lives comfortably in her own house with her two children. Gemima earns a living through buying and selling wood. Starting early in the morning, she heads from her house to different stalls in the city, where she searches for the best pieces of wood to undergo finishing. The finished products are boards, slats, and other items, which are sent to clients located in nearby towns. Gemima does all this work with her husband's help. She has been doing this work for  two years now and is very happy as the income is satisfactory for supporting her household.  

Occasionally, Gemima also earns money by selling fish. At first, this work was difficult and tiring for her, as a certain amount of strength is required; however, she became used to it over time and now works without any difficulty and at a good pace. She hopes to continue and improve this. 

Gemima is currently asking for S/. 3500, and is grateful and happy to know that she can count on financial support in order to advance her business. With the requested loan, she will buy wood to finish and send to other towns.

loans.use: to buy wood wholesale.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is 62 years old; he is married and has two sons and one daughter.  Saleh has been raising seasonal fruits and vegetables for the past 13 years. He chose this business because it is profitable and because there is always high demand for fresh food. People use fresh vegetables every day, and include them in many national dishes, such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served at every family table in Azerbaijan and are often made into fresh punch. 

Saleh sells his crops in the Imishli central bazaar. His monthly income is 200 AZN; Saleh also receives a pension. His son actively helps him raise his crops.  

As his products are in high demand, Saleh wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to meet market demand. For this purpose, he has applied for a loan of 1,900 AZN. He will buy seeds and fertilizer with his loan. 

This will be his seventh loan, and he has a positive loan history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is a 53-year-old married woman. She has eight children, and describes herself as caring. 

She operates a fish store and sells fish. Prisca will use the KES 21,000 loan to buy a 3,000 litre water tank that will benefit eleven people. The family faces a challenge of water shortage, and they spent a lot of time searching for water; they will be able to store and access clean water. 

Prisca hopes that in the future she will buy a boat for fishing; she will be able to get fish at a cheaper price. 

This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a 3,000 litre water tank.

loans.name: The Unity Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “The Unity Group" from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 700,000 for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Isatu is the featured leader of this group. The 39-year-old is married to a miner, and they have four children. Isatu has been a businesswoman for three years now.  She sells palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), pepper, salt, Maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), onions, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock. 

With her, also on the right side of the photo, is loan officer Edward, posing with the borrowers.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, pepper, salt, Maggi, onions, etc. wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Yei

texts.en:
Yei is 40 years old and lives in Sanniqiuillie City, the capital city of Nimba county. She is married and has two children ages 20 and 22, who are attending some collage and live at home since their father built the house they reside in. 

For the past four years she has been selling food ingredients such as peppers, Vita, onions, etc.. in the local market. She has a lot of customers and makes a lot of profit since she is the only one who sells quality food ingredients, especially during the rainy season. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more peppers, Vita, onions, etc... for her business. Her plans are to expand her business and see her children graduate from college.

loans.use: to purchase more peppers, Vita, onions, etc.. for her business.

loans.name: Salamatkhan

texts.ru: Саламатхан 48 лет, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей. Супруг и двое сыновей находятся на заработках в России, ежемесячно высылают свою зарплату. Саламатхан в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Саламатхан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 8 дойных коров, 20 овец, а также 1,5 ГА земельной доли на которой выращивает кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Саламатхан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки 2 голов крупного рогатого скота. Доходы от кредита Саламатхан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Salamtkhan is 48 and married and raising four children. Her husband and two of her sons are currently working in Russia and send back their earnings every month. Salamtkhan is the primary income earner for her family through her work raising animals and crops. Thanks to her hard work, her farm now includes eight milking cows and 20 sheep as well as 1.5 hectares of land on which she grows corn. Her monthly profits amount to 8,000 KGS. 

With the goal of further developing her farm, Salamtkhan has turned to microfinance bank "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 100,000 KGS to increase her head count of livestock by purchasing two big-horned cattle. Revenue from the loan will be invested into further increases in her quantity of livestock.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Assiba

texts.fr: Jeune femme de 36ans, Assiba travaille comme revendeuse de cartes de recharge. Elle le fait de façon ambulante depuis 2003 et par moment est confrontée au problème de mévente. Son crédit sollicité à WAGES l'aidera à acheter des cartes de recharge et des kit de connexion.  Comme perspectives d'avenir, Assiba voudrait ouvrir une boutique et avoir une famille épanouie.
texts.en:
A young woman of 36 years, Assiba works as a reseller of rechargeable cards. She has been doing this door to door since 2003 and has faced slumps in the business from time to time.

The requested loan from WAGES will help her purchase the rechargeable cards and connection transfer kits. In looking to the future, Assiba would like to open a shop and have a well-fulfilled family.

loans.use: purchase transfer kits and rechargeable cards

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca lives in Ganta. She is 35 years old and has six children between 8 and 16 years old. All of her children attend school and live at home. She stopped her education in the fifth grade. She is married; her husband is a farmer. For the past 14 years she has been running a shop where she sells rice by cups. She started this business with money that she received from her husband. A problem she faces is that customers are not available sometimes. She sells from Monday to Saturday, spending twelve hours on her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice to attract customers. Her plans are to build a house for her children and to educate them.

loans.use: to purchase rice

loans.name: Jesus-Wegnigbe 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement JESUS-WEGNIGBE 1 est composé de huit membres qui vivent  dans le même village.  La représentante  de ce groupement, du nom de  Afiavi (est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 38 ans. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Afiavi est mariée à un certain Albert. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge.  Afiavi vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Depuis cinq ans, Afiavi vend des tissus par la méthode de distribution dans sa région. Afiavi s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’accroitre le niveau de son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Afiavi ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement JESUS-WEGNIGBE 1 sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group Jesus-Wegnigbe 1 is made up of 7 members who live in the same village. The representative of this group, named Afiavi (the woman pictured with her hand raised) is 38 years old.

To achieve their goal of enhancing the level of their business and to better meet the demands of their customers, this group is, for the first time, requesting the financial assistance of ALIDé.

Afiavi is married to Albert. The couple has four children, of whom some attend school and all of them are in their care. Afiavi lives together with her husband and their children. The couple works together to meet the needs of the household.

For the last five years, Afiavi has sold fabrics as a distributor in her region. She stocks up at a market in Benin. In order to enhance the level of her business and to meet the needs of her customers, Afiavi, together with the other members of Jesus-Wegnigbe 1 is requesting a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: purchase fabrics

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a married man; he has two children and he describes himself as determined. 

He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. His family faces a challenge of accessing clean water, and they have to travel a long distance to fetch water. The tank will enable them store enough water. 

Paul hopes that in the future he will have an improved standard of living. 

This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.  The previous loan of KES 20,000 was successfully paid.

loans.use: buy a water tank to store clean water

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замире 45 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. Замира работает в территориальной больнице-поваром. Стаж работы 27 лет.Супруг работает в этой же больнице-рентгенологом. Замира в качестве дополнительного дохода более 25 лет назад начала свой бизнес в разведении скота. Использовав  свой стартовый капитал в сумме всего лишь 4,000 сом (KGS), Замира смогла развить свое хозяйство с численностью в: 4 дойных коров, 30 овец. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Замира обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного скота. Доходы Замира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, а в будущем – накопить средства для проведения свадьбы сына.
texts.en: Zamira is 45 and married and, together with her husband, raising four children. She has been working in the regional hospital as a cook for 27 years. Her husband works in the same hospital as a radiologist. More than 25 years ago, Zamira started a business raising cattle to supplement her income. With just 4,000 KGS in starting capital she was able to build up to having four milk cows and 30 sheep on her farm. Zamira has turned to "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a 100,000 KGS loan to purchase more cattle for further development of her business. She plans to invest the profits into further increases of head count of cattle and, in the future, to save enough money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Rigoberto De Jesús

texts.es: Rigoberto, a sus 58 años de edad, es casado y padre de diez hijos. Toda la vida la ha pasado en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agrícolas gracias a las enseñanzas y a la tradición de su familia. Hoy en día es propietario de la finca donde reside, ya que fue la herencia que le dejaron sus padres, allí posee cultivos de caña y café, cuya cosecha es recolectada y vendida en la plaza de mercado del pueblo donde reside. El cliente es un señor pujante y trabajador, se esmera por sacar adelante su familia, sobrepasando obstáculos que se le presentan a nivel económico porque en ocasiones no ha tenido el capital para comprar los insumos que requiere para el cuidado de sus cultivos, lo que le ha ocasionado pérdidas de cosecha. Es por esto que se motiva a solicitar el crédito, que será invertido en la compra de abonos, riegos, pesticidas, fertilizantes y fungicidas para continuar cuidando sus cultivos y obtener cosechas de mayor calidad; de esta manera podrá vender los productos a mejor precio en el mercado, lo que dará como resultado el incremento en sus ingresos. Así Rigoberto estará en la capacidad de brindar a su familia, mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar, además podrá dar a sus hijos menores la posibilidad de una excelente educación para que tengan un futuro más exitoso y prometedor.
texts.en:
Rigoberto, who is 58 years old, is married and has ten children. He has spent his whole life in the fields, where he learned how to farm thanks to his family's teachings and tradition. Today he owns the farm where he lives, since he inherited it from his parents. He grows sugar cane and coffee beans, and after the crops are harvested he sells them at the market square in the town where he resides. 

This client is a vigorous and hard working gentleman who strives to provide for his family. He overcomes the financial hurdles that arise, for there have been times when he didn't have the capital to purchase the supplies he needs to care for his crops, which has caused losses of harvest. That is why he has decided to request this loan, which will be invested in purchasing fertilizers, irrigation supplies, pesticides, and fungicides to keep caring for his crops and obtain higher quality harvests. This will allow him to sell his products at the market at a higher price, which will result in higher income. This way Rigoberto will be in a position to offer his family better living conditions and wellbeing. He will also be able to give his younger children the chance to have an excellent education so that they can have a more successful and promising future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, irrigation supplies, pesticides, and fungicides wholesale.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, de 54 años es una mujer emprendedora y muy dinámica, está casada, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 3 ya son mayores e independientes, viven en su casa propia junto a sus otros dos hijos y su esposo. Norma se dedica a la venta cosméticos y otros accesorios femeninos de uso cotidiano. Vende perfumes, talcos, cremas corporales además de aretes y diversas joyas. Toda su mercadería es enviada en grandes paquetes desde otra ciudad. Todos los días ella va en busca de sus clientes por las calles de la ciudad visitando casa por casa para vender sus productos al contado o al crédito realizando la cobranza en forma diaria, semanal o quincenal. Realiza este oficio hace 10 años y algunas veces recibe el apoyo de su hijo quien le ayuda en el traslado de su mercadería. Se siente muy satisfecha por lo bien que le va en esta nueva etapa.Le gusta mucho tener este trabajo porque le permite disponer de su tiempo y realizar las labores de su hogar con mucha comodidad, además a aprendido a ganarse el respeto y la confianza de los clientes gracias a su buen trato y su gran sonrisa, tiene buenas ventas y como resultado de ello obtiene buenas ganancias económicas. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3000, por tanto agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su acceso al préstamo que necesita para cumplir con sus objetivos laborales. El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería conformada por diversos tipos de cosméticos y accesorios femeninos.
texts.en:
Norma is 54 years old and is a very dynamic, entrepreneurial woman who is married and has 5 children. Three of her children are grown up, and her two youngest children still live with her and her husband. Norma makes a living selling cosmetics and other feminine accessories, including perfume, powders, lotions, creams, earrings and a wide variety of jewelry. She buys all her merchandise in bulk from a nearby city, and she travels door to door around her town selling products to her clients. Norma always tries to work with her clients' financial needs and offer payments plans where customers can pay in smaller installments every week or two weeks. She has ten years experience in this trade, and she is grateful that business is going well. Norma's son also works with her to help transport merchandise around town.

One of the aspects Norma likes best about her work is the flexibility to gives her to work from home and set her own schedule. In addition, it has been gratifying to see how her clients have come to really respect and appreciate her over the years, as she is always kind and gracious to them and greets them with a big smile. With the support from this loan Norma plans to purchase cosmetics and accessories in bulk to stock her business. She is grateful to all the lenders who are making this opportunity possible and are helping her fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics in bulk to stock her business.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 23-year-old single man from Lebanon. In 2010, after seeing a necessity to help his family financially, he decided to start work as a painter. He works independently, taking on multiple projects to complete. His end results are always satisfactory and pleasing to customers. 

Today Abbas is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to get new painting equipment and improve his services. 

In the future, Abbas plans to request additional Kiva loans as he intends to open his own painting shop.

loans.use: to get new painting equipment.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a married man aged 53 and supporting 12 members of the family.  His children are seven in number aged between 30 and 11 years.  He is a livestock farmer in the Koibatek area, and has been in operation over a period of 13 years, earning an income of KES 10,000.

He is now servicing his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD, and intends to use this amount to purchase sheep and cows for his farm.  The anticipated amounts will be used to add more livestock.  

His dream is to live a comfortably with his family, and also make more profits from his business.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock.

loans.name: Servina

texts.en:
Servina is a 63-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has three grown children. She grows and sells rice. She has been farming rice for more than 10 years. Aside from farming, Servina makes native mats and hats from buri (palm) leaves to augment her income.

Servina has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and rice seedlings and to pay a laborer's fee, to make use of her farm and source of income. In the future, Servina would like to expand her farming business to save money in preparation for her old age.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seedlings and pay for labor

loans.name: Unity Sisters Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the Unity Sisters group from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 3,700,000 SLL for the entire team. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Umu is the featured leader of this group. The 35-year-old is married to a businessman and they have one child. Umu has been a businesswoman for four years now; she sells plastic shoes and slippers. With her share of this loan, she will buy more shoes and slippers wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy shoes and slippers to add to her current stock

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 39-year-old married Lebanese man living with his wife. He has worked as a furniture manufacturer since 2000. He is very gifted and completes his work professionally and competently. He cooperates financially with his wife, who sells pickles to be able to pay the heavy costs of living.

Today, Hussein is in need to have a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase wood. Hussein’s current plan is to increase his business productivity with the aim of benefiting from a higher income and enhancing the family’s way of living.

loans.use: to purchase wood.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 43-year-old married man from Lebanon who lives with his wife (a housewife) and four children who are still attending school. In 2007, after 25 years of experience working as a butcher, he decided to open his own butchery in the town where he lives. He offers fresh meat to his customers and that’s what attracts more people. 

Today, Mohamad is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to expand his operations by purchasing a new refrigerator in order to keep the food in good condition, and a new cutting machine that will ease his work, especially as the old one has almost become rusty. Mohamad is very optimistic and only cares about expanding his work to earn a higher income and better support his family, especially because he is the main and sole income source.

loans.use: purchasing a new refrigerator and a new cutting machine

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a 45-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as focused. 

Her family faces a challenge of accessing clean water. They have to travel a long distance to fetch water. She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. The tank will enable them to store enough water. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. 

This is Anna's second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water tank to store clean water

loans.name: Qurbongul

texts.ru:
Курбонгул многодетная мать. У нее четверо дочерей в возрасте от 23-х до 8 лет и двое сыновей в возрасте 22 и 18 лет. Курбонгул проживает со своей большой и дружной семьей в районе Яван. Она вместе со старшими дочерьми занимается шитьем. Муж работает в управлении по социальной защите населения. Один их сын находится на заработках в России, а трое детей еще учатся в школе. 
Курбонгул хочет заняться семейным животноводческим бизнесом. В ее хозяйстве имеется одна корова местной породы для нужды семьи. Курбонгул просит кредит в размере 1100 долларов США, чтобы приобрести  трех голов коров и начать бизнес по откорму-продаже скота. У нее созданы все условия для содержания и выращивания скота. В новом бизнесе ей будут помогать муж и второй сын.
texts.en:
Qurbongul is a mother of many children: four daughters ranging from eight to 23 and two sons aged 18 and 22. She lives with her large and happy family in the Yavan region. She and her older daughters work as seamstresses and her husband works in the department of social welfare. One of their sons is working in Russia, and three children are still in school.

Qurbongul wants to start a family business raising livestock. She already owns one cow of a local breed for her family's needs. She is requesting a loan of US$1,100 to acquire three cows and start a business fattening and selling cattle. She already has everything needed to house and raise cattle. Her husband and second son will help her with the new business.

loans.use: to purchase three cows to start a business fattening and selling cattle

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a 34-year-old business woman from Liberia. She is an unmarried woman who has four children between 9 and 19. She describes herself as hard working.

She lives in Nimba, a county in Liberia that shares a border with Guinea and Cote D’Ivoire. Because of its status as a border county, trade is the primary activity in the region. It also has the second highest population in Liberia. 

Martha has had a cook shop (restaurant) which sells G.B. (dough made of cassava), rice, and soup for the past six years now. She works 14 hours at her business. Her greatest challenge in business is the price of dry meat. She intends to use the loan to buy more dry meat, fish, rice, pepper, vita, etc., for her business. She started her business by selling her garden produce. She likes her business because it keeps her busy. She hopes to one day buy a car.  

She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to buy more dry meat, fish, rice, pepper, vita, etc. for her business

loans.name: Silvio Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a client of Finance Sudan Limited. He is 27 years of age and a father of two children.

Kennedy is a businessman who owns a retail shop that sells a mixed variety of goods. Some of the goods that Kennedy sells are soaps, sodas, beers, and sugar. He is borrowing a loan worth 2,500 South Sudanese pounds to enable him to expand his business. He will use the loan to buy more stock for his shop.

loans.use: to buy items like soap, sugar, soda, and beer

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en: Winfred is a 39-year-old married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be business oriented. He will use the KES 21,000 loan to purchase a 3,000 liter water tank that will benefit five family members. It’s a challenge for the family to access water since they live far from the water source. The tank will enable them to store water for domestic use and reduce the amount of time spent going to fetch water. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to purchase a 3,000 liter water tank

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as being very honest. She will use the KES 7,000 loan to buy a water dispenser that will benefit three people in her family. They face a challenge of accessing clean water. They will be able to store and access clean water from the dispenser for drinking. This is Margaret's third loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM). Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water dispenser.

loans.name: Umut

texts.ru: Умут 63 года, замужем, мать-героиня, вместе с мужем воспитывают 11 детей. Умут имеет средне-специальное образование. В 1972 году окончила кооперативный техникум. С 1972-1993 годы работала продавцом в разных учреждениях. С 1993 года вместе с мужем решили заняться животноводством и полеводством. Супруги оптимистично смотрят и идут по жизни. Знают конкретно чего хотят и добиваются всего своими силами, а также знают как правильно использовать и планировать денежные средства для достижения поставленных целей. Начали этот бизнес с 1,000 сом (KGS). Опыт в разведении и содержании скота, а также в полеводстве очень большой. Благодаря упорному труду Умут и ее большой и дружной семьи, в хозяйстве у них имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 лошади, 1 кобыла, 4 теленка, 40 овец, 30 ягнят, также имеет земельный надел, размером 1,5 ГА на которой ежегодно выращивают картофель и кукурузу. Ее хозяйство приносит около 30,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды большой семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Умут обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита Умут планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Umut is 63 year sold, married and a mother-hero.  She and her husband are raising 11 children.  Umut has a secondary-specialized education.  She graduated from a co-operative college in 1972.  She worked as a salesperson at various organizations from 1972-1993.  Her husband and she decided to get involved in animal husbandry and farming in 1993.  The spouses have an optimistic outlook and progress in life.  They know precisely what they want and achieve everything with their own efforts, and also know how to correctly use and plan financial means for achieving set goals.  They started this business with 1,000 som (KGS).  They have a lot of experience in breeding and keeping livestock and in farming.  Thanks to Umut's and her large and friendly family's hard work, their business now contains two dairy cows, two horses, one mare, four calves, forty sheep, thirty lambs, and also a 1.5 hectare land plot, where they annually grow potatoes and corn.  Her business yields about 30,000 som (KGS) per month, which serves as a basis for covering expenses for food and basic needs of the large family.  In order to further develop her business, Umut requested a loan in the amount of 130,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy cows.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued increase of her business.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Ramiriza Group

texts.fr:
Dénise  fait partie du groupe  Ramiriza et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle  a 48 ans et est mariée à Isidore, un fonctionnaire. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants  âgés de 17 à 18 ans, tous étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce des habits depuis 12 ans. 

Elle est à son treizième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait augmenter son stock d'habits et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Dénise is a member of the Ramiriza group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 48 years old and is married to Isidore, a local government officer. Together, they have two children who are 17 and 18 years old. Both of their children go to school. 

She has been in business for 12 years, and this is her 13th loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan that she receives, she will increase her capital and buy a lot of clothing that she can sell in order to increase her earnings. 

In the next few years, she would like to grow her inventory of clothing and see to it that her children study.

loans.use: increase her capital and buy a lot of clothing that she can sell in order to increase her earnings.

loans.name: Paola

texts.es: Paola, de 35 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Paola se dedica a la venta de productos regionales, realiza esta labor de lunes a viernes por las noches en el frontis de su vivienda en donde diariamente instala una mesa y algunas sillas. Eventualmente realiza sus ventas recorriendo las principales calles de la ciudad. Atiende siempre muy amablemente a sus clientes por lo que ha logrado tener buena acogida y demanda. Realiza este negocio desde hace 20 años y cuenta con la ayuda de su hijo. Por fortuna logra vender todo lo que prepara a diario gracias a su exquisita sazón. Por las mañanas trabaja como empleada del hogar en una vivienda cercana a su casa. Le gusta cocinar pues aprendió de su madre los secretos culinarios. No le gusta el cansancio físico ya que tiene que levantarse muy temprano para realizar los preparativos del día, pero eso no la desanima y continúa trabajando por eso desea ampliar su negocio y mejorar sus mesas y sillas donde pueda atender con mayor comodidad a sus clientes. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/.1200, por tanto agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para acceder al crédito que necesita para continuar con el logro de sus metas. Con el monto solicitado comprará arroz, condimentos, carnes, aceites, gaseosas y algunos utensilios de cocina para renovar sus enseres.
texts.en:
Paola is 35 years old and lives with her husband and three children in their own house. Paola makes a living cooking and selling traditional food dishes Monday through Friday out of her home, where she has set up tables and chairs to accommodate customers. She also travels around selling her food dishes in town. Since she makes delicious, high quality food dishes and sells them at reasonable prices with wonderful service, Paola has grown her customer base and has created substantial demand for her various dishes. With 20 years of experience in this trade, Paola knows exactly how much food to prepare for each day of the week, and she rarely has any leftovers. In the mornings before she opens up her food stand, Paola works as a housekeeper in a nearby home.

Paola loves to cook, and she learned all her culinary secrets from her mother. While she does not like the taxing routine of waking up extremely early to prepare all her food for the day, she does not let these challenges dampen her spirits and positive attitude. With the support from this loan, Paola plans to purchase ingredients to stock her food business, including rice, meat, oil, condiments, soft drinks, plastic silverware and cooking utensils. She hopes this investment will help her to expand and strengthen her business ad eventually be able to purchase more tables and chairs so she can accommodate more customers.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to stock her food business, including rice, meat, oil, condiments, soft drinks, plastic silverware and cooking utensils.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 23-year-old businesswoman from Liberia. She is unmarried and has no children. She is a college student. She describes herself as hardworking.

She lives in Nimba, a county in Liberia that shares a border with Guinea and Cote D’Ivoire. Because of its status as a border county, trade is the primary activity in the region. It also has the second highest population in Liberia. 

Alice has a table-based business from which she has been selling slippers over the past three years. She works eight hours at her business. Her greatest challenge in business is few goods in her inventory. She intends to use the loan to buy more slippers for her business. She started her business with money from her mother. She likes her business because she realizes profit at times. She hopes to one day move from a table business to a shop.   

She is thankful for your support!

loans.use: to buy more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Wondoima Group-I

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Wondoima” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 3,300,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) for the entire group in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Sia is the featured leader of this group. Sia is 37 years old and married with four children; two in primary school and two in secondary school. Sia sells market food – rice, salt, pepper, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), cooking oil, onions, etc., and has been doing this business for 12 years now. With the help of this loan, Sia will invest in her business by buying rice, salt, pepper, margi seasoning, cooking oil, onions, etc., in large quantities to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy rice, salt, pepper, margi seasoning, cooking oil, onions, etc., in large quantities to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 18 years old and lives in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Eva has been working hard to manage her raw foods business, which sells matooke, sweet potatoes. 

To help expand her business, Eva has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase matooke and will help Eva to generate greater profits and to increase her income. Eva hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Eva is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase matooke

loans.name: Ibis

texts.es: Ibis, de 28 años, es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora. Está casada y tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 5 años de edad respectivamente. Vive en casa de sus suegros. Ibis se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas y ocasionalmente también vende cervezas. Diariamente abre las puertas de su casa en donde tiene un espacio acondicionado para la atención de los clientes que llegan en busca de alguna bebida para calmar su sed. Continuamente abastece su negocio comprando la cantidad de gaseosas necesarias para la venta del día. Ofrece a la venta diversas marcas y sabores a diferentes precios. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 6 años y hasta el momento lo hace sola. Considera que su actividad es muy rentable debido a la demanda que existe en la ciudad donde vive lo cual se traduce en considerables ganancias económicas. Espera continuar trabajando en esta actividad y con el paso del tiempo espera tener un local mas amplio. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2800, está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le brindan para que pueda seguir adelante con su trabajo, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará progresivamente mayor cantidad de bebidas gasificadas en diversas marcas y presentaciones.
texts.en:
Ibis, 28 years old, is an enterprising and hardworking woman. She is married and has two children, who are 7 and 5 years old, respectively. She lives with her in-laws. Ibis sells soft drinks and occasionally beer, as well. Every day, she opens the doors of her house where she has set up a space to wait on customers who come in search of a drink to quench their thirst. She constantly re-stocks her business, buying just the number of soft drinks she needs for her daily sales. She provides a variety of brands and flavors at different prices. She has been doing this work for the past six years and up to now, she has worked alone.
