Ibis feels that her business is very profitable because of the demand that exists in the city, which translates into considerable financial gain. She expects to continue working in the business and in time she hopes to have a more spacious shop. 

At this time she will be applying for S/. 2,800. She is very pleased with the financial support being provided to her so that she can continue moving her business forward. As well, she is committed to making her payments punctually. With the sum requested, she will purchase progressively greater quantities of soft drinks of different kinds and brands.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks wholesale.

loans.name: Santa Catalina Group

texts.es:
Santa Catalina es un grupo numeroso, ellas están trabajando juntas y se ayudan las unas a las otras para poder cumplir con las metas que tienen. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza y así conocer la situación de cada una de ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Esperanza, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir con ingresos muy bajos. Ella es peluquera, y cuenta que tiene una variada clientela que siempre acude a su salón y que gracias a ello está saliendo adelante y ayudando a su familia, es una persona muy sacrificada que con esfuerzo ha ido mejorando.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, ruleros, tijeras y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir cumpliendo con sus clientes y darles un buen servicio.
texts.en:
Santa Catalina is a large group.  They are working together and helping each other fulfill their goals.  They are part of a poverty elimination survey, which involves getting to know the situation of one of them.

One of the group members is Esperanza, who in the last survey was found to be in the first poverty level (meaning very low income).  She is a hair dresser and says that she has a varied clientele.  Her customers always turn to her salon and thanks to this, she is getting ahead and helping her family.  She sacrifices a great deal for them and she has continually progressed, thanks to her efforts.

She is asking for this loan to buy dyes, shampoo, rinses, hair rollers, scissors, and other things.  In this way, she will be able to continue satisfying her customers and giving them good service.

loans.use: buy dyes, shampoo, rinses, hair rollers, scissors, etc.

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es: Luciano, de 45 años, es un hombre jovial y muy amable, es padre de 04 hijos los que ya son independientes, vive en su casa propia a lado de su esposa. El trabajo de Luciano consiste es la siembra  de cacao, plátanos, Yucas y otros productos de la zona, durante mucho tiempo sufrió algunos contratiempos en su vida por la erradicación de algunos productos, al pasar el tiempo con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo fue labrando  sus tierras hasta conseguir que vuelva a producir, es por eso que desde hace un 10 años decidió sembrara productos alternativos como son el cacao, café, plátano, entre otros. También cuando esta en su casa se dedica a la venta de distintas bebidas gasificadas de distintos sabores y marcas. Le gusta lo que hace, pues le permite tener tiempo para poder estar al cuidado de su vivienda, además que desde que empezó con su negocio le está yendo bien en su economía, ya que tienen dos ingresos para su hogar. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles comprará abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Luciano is 45 years old and is a very kind, joyful man who is the father of four young children. He lives with his wife and children in their own home, and he works as a cacao, yucca and banana farmer. Over the years, Luciano has faced many challenges and setbacks in his farming operation, and 10 years ago he decided to start planting alternative, organic crops such as cacao, coffee, bananas, etc. In addition, he also sells a wide variety of soft drinks from his home to generate additional income.

Luciano enjoys his work, and he likes that it allows him to have some free time to maintain and look after his house. He is grateful that business is going well, and he is also grateful to have two jobs and two sources of income. This is his first Kiva loan, and he is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make all scheduled loan repayments on time. With the support from this loan, Luciano plans to purchase organic manure and fertilizer for tending his crops.

loans.use: to purchase organic manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: This is 36-year-old Julius. He is married and has three children ages 5, 3, and 1 month. In 2011, Julius established his bar and restaurant business. He began his business because he wants to provide a livelihood for his family. Working 7 days a week, 14 hours a day, he earns about SLL 800,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Julius requires a loan in order to buy more drinks and food for his restaurant for resale. In the future, Julius plans to become an international businessman, educate his children to university level, and build his own house. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks and food for resale

loans.name: Aleksandre

texts.en:
Aleksandre is a 45-year-old farmer from the village of Tsinandali, Kakheti Region. He is married and lives with his wife, retired mother and two school-age children in his own house. Aleksandre cultivates a plot of land and sows maize. The harvest is sold at the local open market. His wife works as a teacher at the local school and gets a small monthly salary.

Aleksandre works hard in his plot of land, but his income is seasonal and the family needs a monthly source to cover food and everyday expenses. That is why Aleksandre decided to start his own business. He owns a mini-bus and wishes to work on a line, but there are no seats in his car, as Aleksandre used to work transport service with it. 

All of the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, Aleksandre applied for the credit from MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of a Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva. This program enables the vulnerable poor to start or restart businesses. A loan of $2,200 will help him to purchase and install seats and arrange the car interior suitably. Once the minibus is rearranged, he will work on the minibus line and transport the passengers from one district to another. This business initiative will generate an income. With the increased income, he will be able to improve the living conditions of his family members.

loans.use: to install the seats in his minibus for working on the line.

loans.name: Nduni

texts.en:
Nduni is a 36-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a grocery store where she sells onions, bananas and other items to earn an income. 

She will use the 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This will benefit her six family members. Her family faces a challenge of accessing clean water. They have to travel a long distance to fetch water. The tank will enable them store enough water and access it easily. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. 

This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
This is Martha from Liberia. She lives in Saclepea in Nimba County. She is 50 years old and is married with five children aged 15 to 18 years old. All her children live at home and attend school. 

For the past 3 years, Martha has been selling coconut bread. She requested a loan to purchase more dry coconut, sugar, flour, etc. for her business. She says that the high price of flour is a challenge. She started this business with a small amount of money from her susu (local saving).

Martha enjoys that customers buy from her, and she is proud of her business because she makes her own money. She wants to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more dry coconut, sugar, flour, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 40-year-old, hard-working woman, with three children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

She operates a clothes business, but also earns extra income on a monthly basis from rental houses. Ever-changing customer preferences and inadequate capital affects the business growth, while her dream is to have a modern boutique and to construct on her plot of land. 

Margret intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 42 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Baou, quartier Bamanan commune de Banco, préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale (mil mais et du riz) et du beurre de karité. Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire.  Djenebou  la première personne à droite dans le rang des debout compte acheter 3 sacs de riz non décortiqué, 2 sacs de niébé et 45 kg d’arachide. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen 24.000FCFA par mois. Ce bénéfice  lui permet de se vêtir et d’aider son mari dans la résolution des problèmes familiaux.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is comprised of married women who are 42 years old on average, and who have an average of five children. They all live in extended traditional families in the Bamanan district of the village of Baou. Baou is in the town of Banco, which is in the Dioila prefecture in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They came to know one another through relatives, neighbors, and friends. They sell grains (millet, corn, and rice) and shea butter. This is the second group loan for the women of the Benkadi group. 

Djenebou, pictured at right in the front row, will buy three sacks of unshelled rice, two sacks of black-eyed peas, and 45 kg of peanuts. 

She would like to earn an average profit of 24,000 FCFA per month. The profits will allow her to clothe herself and help her husband resolve family problems.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en:
Naheed is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been doing a business of crockery sales for nine months. She offers different crockery items of plastic and steel such as plates, bowls, glasses, etc. Her husband also assists her in selling them to the people of their community and in the local market. She makes a sufficient amount of income to contribute in the family income. 

For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 35,000. In this way she will be able to purchase different crockery items such as bowls, baskets, and glasses in various sizes and designs. It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation and she has shown good repayment behavior. She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase different crockery items such as bowls, baskets, and glasses in various sizes and designs.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Janet, from Liberia. She lives in Saclepea, of Nimba County. She is married. Her husband is a farmer. They both have five children, ages between 18 and 20, only one is attending school and lives at home. 

For the past four years, Janet has been selling used clothes in the local market. She has more customers and makes more profit from her business. She works at her business, spending ten hours per day. She describes herself as a hard-working businessperson. Most of the time, she uses a taxi to get her goods to her market table. 

Janet is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plans are to expand her business and to build a house for her children. She happily thanks you for the support!

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz, age 46, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. 

She is a dedicated mother of two. She needs to improve her business to meet the needs of her children. For this reason she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 35,000 to purchase another cow. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with good loan history. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya, age 36, is a married woman and a mother of six. She has been running a business of carpet manufacturing for many years. She is very famous in her circle for providing various designs of carpets and rugs. Her daughters also help her complete the orders of her customers in time. 

She has improved her business gradually with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently, she has requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers. It will help her to inflate her sales which ultimately help in generating more cash. She is in her 5th loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers.

loans.name: Olegi

texts.en:
Olegi is from the village of Itkhvisi, West Georgia. He is 53 years old and lives with his wife and school age daughter. Olegi is involved in an agricultural business and owns a vineyard. He produces wine and vodka with the harvested grapes and sells the products in his district. 

Besides his agricultural activities, Olegi owns a small café and is actively involved in the fast food industry. The business is going well but it needs financial support for further development. With the received loan, Olegi will purchase an espresso machine and install it in his café. He will brew fresh coffee and attract more customers. Olegi hopes that his business initiative will generate income and improve the living standard of his family members.

loans.use: to purchase an espresso machine for his cafe.

loans.name: Leticia Amparo

texts.es: Leticia, a sus 48 años de edad, es casada y madre de 3 hijos.  Desde hace 13 años comenzó a involucrarse en el mundo de las confecciones, inició laborando en un pequeño taller cercano a su casa donde obtuvo los primeros conocimientos, más adelante se le presentó la oportunidad de emplearse en una empresa más grande y con un salario más alto; allí aprendió nuevas técnicas y perfeccionó sus conocimientos. Aprovechando la experiencia adquirida y un crédito que le habían aprobado, decidió independizarse y montó su propio taller, en el cual le confecciona a terceros y para ello, cuenta con el apoyo de su hija mayor y dos empleadas directas. De esta forma ha generado los ingresos necesarios para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar. La cliente manifiesta que le gusta mucho su labor, aunque a veces debe afrontar desafíos que le retrasan la producción, por ejemplo, conseguir las operarias que sean ágiles y que terminen bien los productos, pues de esto depende la continuidad de los contratos con sus clientes, sin embargo, ha sabido salir adelante. Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de 2 máquinas planas, las cuales requiere para agilizar su producción y poder cumplir oportunamente con la entrega de los pedidos. Esto le permitirá abrirse las puertas para obtener más contratos y en un futuro a mediano plazo, sueña con confeccionar su línea propia, ampliar el taller y generar más oportunidades de empleo a madres cabezas de hogar. Esto beneficiará no sólo la calidad de vida de su familia, sino la de muchas otras personas que influyen en su labor.
texts.en:
Leticia, 48 years old, is married and the mother of three children. Thirteen years ago she began to be involved in the world of sewing. She began by working in a small workshop near her home where she obtained her first experience. Later she had the opportunity to work for a much larger business at a much higher salary. There she learned new techniques and perfected her knowledge. Taking advantage of the experience she had acquired and a loan that had been approved for her, she decided to become independent and opened her own workshop where she sews for third parties; for this, she relies on help from her oldest daughter and two employees. In this way she has generated the earnings necessary to help her husband with household expenses.

Leticia states that she greatly enjoys her work although at times she needs to confront challenges that can delay production. For examples she needs to obtain skilled workers who do good finishing work since it is upon such skills that the continuation of  contracts from her customers depends. Nevertheless, she has known how to get ahead.

Currently, she is requesting a loan in order to purchase two flat sewing machines that she needs to streamline production and to be able to finish the orders she has received in a timely manner. This will enable her to open her doors to accept more contracts. In the future, in the medium term, she dreams of producing her own line, expanding her workshop and generating more employment opportunities for mothers who are heads of households. This will not only increase her own family’s quality of life but that of many other persons who influence her business.

loans.use: to purchase two flat sewing machines.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: Alejandra, de 45 años, es una mujer muy amable y esforzada, es madre de 03 hijos los cuales ya son independientes, por está razón vive solamente con su esposo en su casa propia. El trabajo de Alejandra consiste en la venta de refrescos  de frutas tales como maracuyá, naranjas, mandarinas, etc. Durante mucho tiempo sufrió algunos contratiempos en su vida por el terrorismo que invadía la ciudad y no tenía un ingreso para su hogar, es por eso que desde hace un 10 años decidió empezar un nuevo proyecto que era la venta de refrescos de frutas. Le gusta lo que hace, pues le permite tener tiempo para poder estar al cuidado de su vivienda, además que desde que empezó con su negocio le está yendo bien en su economía, ya que tiene mejores ingresos para su hogar, desea seguir creciendo, por eso tiene en mente ampliar sus ventas. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de S/.1000 soles, comprará frutas tales como maracuyá,  papaya, entre otros. También adquirirá mesas y sillas para una mejor atención de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Alejandra is 45 years old and is a friendly, hardworking woman.  She is a mother to 3 children, who are already independent.  For this reason, she lives alone with her husband in their own house.  Alejandra's work involves selling fruit drinks such as passion fruit, oranges, mandarines, etc.  Times were tough for her for a long time due to the presence of terrorism in her city which prevented her from having an income.  This led her to decide to start working selling fruit drinks (which was 10 years ago).

She likes what she does because it gives her time to take care of things at home.  In addition, since starting her business, her financial situation has been improving and her income has improved.  She wants to continue to grow and for this reason she wants to increase her sales.  This is her first experience with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support that she receives so she can progress.  In addition, she promises to make her payments on time.

With the requested loan of 1,000 sols, she will buy fruit such as passion fruit, papaya, and others.  She will also buy tables and chairs to better serve her customers.

loans.use: buy fruits such as passion fruit, papaya, and also seats and tables for her fruit stand.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 19-year-old single Lebanese man. He has been involved in the construction field since 2010. He started to work very early in order to supplement the family’s income and be able to live in good conditions. His job is specialized in painting work. Thanks to his gifted skills, friendly personality, and prompt response, he was able to build a loyal and wide clientele. 

Today, Ali is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase painting tools and supplies. Ali needs to increase his earnings, and to do so he needs to be equipped with the necessary materials to well-serve customers and satisfy their demands.

loans.use: purchase painting tools and supplies.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 22-year-old Lebanese single man. He started to work too early as he was obliged to supplement the family’s income and help the family live in good conditions. He is involved in the construction field, specialized at completing painting jobs. He works on a freelance basis and there are two part-time workers helping him achieve the tasks on overloaded days. 

With the youth loan he requested from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l., Ahmad will perform the needed maintenance on his van with the aim of carrying on with his transportation to clients and projects easily and safely, especially that during work, Ahmad is obliged to be equipped with tough supplies such as scaffolding, paintings, etc.

As for his future plans, he states that he is very eager to become the proprietor of his own painting shop, and to realize that, he notes that he will apply for a new Kiva loan.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on his van.

loans.name: Jovenes De Belen Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Jovenes de Belen está en su ciclo número  2 del programa de comité de jóvenes, ellos se unieron con el objetivo de empezar a trabajar y de esa forma poder sentirse útil y ayudar a un poco a su familia.
El joven Gustavo vende CD y DVD en el microcentro de Ciudad del Este. El mismo solicita el crédito para la compra de mas discos para  aumentar la variedad de su pequeño negocio y de esa forma poder mostrar que trabajando podrá salir adelante.
texts.en:
The group called "Jovenes de Belen" (Youth of Bethlehem) is in its 2nd cycle in the young adults program of their communal bank.  They came together with the goal of working and in this way feel useful and help their families.

Gustavo sells CDs and DVDs in downtown Ciudad del Este.  He is asking for a loan to buy more discs to increase the variety of his small business and in this way be able to show that he can get ahead by working hard.

loans.use: buy CDs to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine, 22 years old, operates a salon in the town of Malindi. She has been in this business for the last three years. She earns a monthly profit of 10,000 KES. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for her first loan of 20,000 KES. Josephine intends to use the loan to add to her inventory some hair weaves, wigs, and hair dyes needed for her business. She will save the anticipated profits and help take care of her niece. In the future, Josephine hopes to grow her salon with a view to opening a full boutique in the area.

loans.use: to add inventory of hair weaves, wigs, hair sprays and similar items to her business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a 40-year-old married woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be future oriented. She operates a cereals store where she sells maize, beans and other items. She will use the 21,000 KES loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. Ten members of the family will benefit from this water tank. She hopes that, in the future, she will expand her business.

loans.use: buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use.

loans.name: Glazs

texts.en:
Glazs is 50 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 18 and 33. Only one child is in school, and they all live at home. She describes herself as hard working. She lives in Nimba, a county in Liberia that shares a border with Guinea and Cote D’Ivoire. Because of its status as a border county, trade is the primary activity in the region. It also has the second highest population in Liberia. 

Glazs has had a table business which sells rice, salt, onions, pepper, oil, etc. for the past eight years. She works long hours at her business. Her greatest challenge in business is fewer goods on her table. She intends to use the loan to buy more rice, salt, onions, pepper, oil, etc. for her business. She started her business with money from her husband. She likes her business because she makes more profits. She hopes to one day build a house. She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to buy more rice, salt, onions, pepper, oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a water tank

loans.name: Nehemiah

texts.en:
Nehemiah is 36 years old and married to Teresiah; together they are blessed with two children ages 7 and 5 1/2.

He has been in the transport business in Naivasha for eight years, and has applied for his first loan from Kadet Ltd to buy a car for transportation purposes.  With the anticipated profit, he hopes to pay school fees.

He hopes to expand his transport business by buying many cars in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a car.

loans.name: Waheeb

texts.en: Waheeb is a 24-year-old married man who has one child and lives in Taiz, Yemen. He has had a bus for one year. He was provided for by his mother to purchase a bus. He has been offering bus transportation services to and from his city for some time now, and his work has kept him increasingly busy. He applied for a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy spare parts for his bus.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his bus.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 37 years old and she lives in Nimba, a county in Liberia that shares a border with Guinea and Cote D’Ivoire.  Because of its status as a border county, trade is the primary activity in the region.  It also has the second highest population in Liberia.

She is married, and has three children, ages 12 to18 who are in school and live at home.  She describes herself as hard-working. 

Nancy has a table business and has been selling rice, onions, peppers, and oil, etc.. for the past eight years.  She works ten hours at her business. She started her business with money from her husband. Her greatest challenge in business is small inventory on hand. 

She intends to use the loan to buy more rice, onions, peppers, and oil, etc... for her business.   

She likes her business because she makes more profit and meets new people every time.  She hopes to one day build a house.  

She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to buy more rice, onions, peppers, and oil, etc.. for her business.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en: Olivia is widowed with three children and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She owns a retail shop and has been in this business for 13 years. She works at the market seven days out of every week. She has applied for a loan of 500000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more sugar, boxes of mineral water, rice, soap, and crates of beer and soda. She generates additional income through farming. Her major business challenge includes seasonality and defaulters.  She aspires to own a fully stocked retail store and also to become a wholesaler.  She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expense includes school fees and paying for the electricity bill.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, boxes of mineral water, rice, soap, and crates of beer and soda.

loans.name: Lutf

texts.en: Lutf, 28 years old, lives with his family in Sana`a, Yemen. He has a grocery store. He is well known and has many customers. He is a hard-working and is a very honorable man, always committed to getting ahead. He thinks the harder you work, the greater your reward will be. He wants to see his business grow and be an absolute success. It is for this reason that he has decided to request a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy soft drinks and canned food for his business. He knows that in this way he will be able to provide his household with a better economic situation.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and canned food for his business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 44 years old and comes from Ndunyu Njeru. She is married with five children between 28 and 9 years old.

She has been in the farming business for 26 years and has applied for her second loan from Kadet Ltd after paying her previous loan well. She intends to pay for school fees with the loan. 

In the near future, Jane hopes to apply for a bigger loan from Kadet Ltd to boost her farming business.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario, de 43 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Rosario, se dedica a la venta de desayunos y almuerzos. Sus principales clientes son los trabajadores de la municipalidad de su localidad quienes siempre le solicitan diversos platillos. Lleva cumpliendo esta labor desde hace 5 años y lo hace con la ayuda de otra cocinera. 
Le está yendo muy buen ya que tiene muchos pedidos por lo cual siempre pone mucha responsabilidad al momento de realizar su trabajo, se siente tranquila ya que ve que cada fin de mes su intensa labor es recompensada con buenas ganancias económicas. Espera que le siga yendo bien para que más adelante pueda expandir su negocio.
En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, es una socia muy responsable y solidaria dentro de su grupo, agradece a quienes le brindan el préstamo que requiere para seguir desarrollando su negocio, está convencida que seguirá siendo una cliente muy puntual y pagará sus cuotas a tiempo. Con el monto solicitado comprará progresivamente los ingredientes e insumos que necesita  para la preparación de comidas como arroz, azúcar, fideos, huevos, pollo, entre otros.
texts.en:
Rosario is 43 years old and the single mother of 3 children who she lives with in their own house. Rosario works selling breakfasts and lunches. Her main customers are the workers of the municipality of her area who always ask for varied meals. She has been doing this job for 5 years and she does it with the help of another cook. It is going very well as she has lots of orders which she takes on when she works. 

She feels calm because she sees that at the end of each month her hard work is recompensed with good profits. She hopes it continues to go well so that later on she can expand her business. 

This time, she is applying for 2000 Soles. She is a very responsible and supportive member of her group. She thanks those who offer her the loan that she needs to continue developing her business. She is sure that she will continue being a punctual client and she will pay her installments on time. With the sum applied for she will progressively buy the ingredients and supplies she needs to prepare the food such as rice, sugar, noodles, eggs, chicken, among others.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, sugar, noodles, eggs, chicken, among others.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth, de 33 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 5 años de edad respectivamente. Juntos están cómodamente instalados en su casa propia. Ruth se dedica a la venta de frutas y productos regionales como naranjas, cocona, camu camu, aguajes, pescados, sal, frijoles, plátano, ajíes entre otros. Diariamente instala una mesa en el frontis de su casa, ahí exhibe todos los productos que pone a la venta. Atiende siempre de manera amable y cordial. Se inició en este negocio hace 1 año y trabaja sola. Eventualmente se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. Antes de emprender esta actividad no realizaba ninguna labor económica, únicamente tenía deseos de ser una persona productiva y generar sus propios ingresos económicos, gracias a su primer préstamo empezó a desarrollar su labor y poco a poco ha ido incrementando la cantidad y variedad de los productos que ofrece a sus clientes. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segunda de avanzar con su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de frutas tales como naranjas, sandias, cocona, frijol, huevos, pescados y otros.
texts.en:
Ruth, 33 years old, is married and has two children, who are 12 and 5 years of age. The family is comfortably installed in their own home. Ruth sells fruit and regional products, such as oranges, cocona (fruit), camu camu (fruit), aguaje (palm fruit), fish, salt, beans, plantains and ajíes (peppers), among others. Every day she sets up a table in front of her house and places all the products there she has for sale. She always waits on customers in a cordial and friendly manner. She started this business one year ago and works alone.  Eventually she has also begun selling beauty products. 

Before she started her business she had never engaged in any paid work. Yet she always wanted to be a productive person and generate her own income. Thanks to her first loan, she began to develop her business and little by little has been increasing the quantity and variety of products that she offers her customers.

At this time she will apply for S/. 1,500. She is very pleased to know she will have financial support because she will be sure she can advance her business. In addition she is committed to making her payments on time. The sum requested will be used to purchase fruit, such as oranges, watermelon, and cocona, as well as beans, eggs, fish and other items.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables such as oranges, watermelon, cocona,  beans, eggs, fish and other items.

loans.name: Roldan

texts.es: Roldan, de 43 años, es padre de 03 hijos que ya son independientes y vive en su casa propia a lado de su esposa. Roldan se dedica a la producción de plátanos, yucas y otros productos de la región, durante mucho tiempo sufrió algunos contratiempos en su vida porque no conseguía empleo ya que la gente abandonaba la ciudad por el miedo al terrorismo, es por eso que desde hace un 13 años decidió empezar un nuevo proyecto con ganas de sobresalir sembrando productos alternativos que daba el gobierno los cuales son el cacao, plátano, café, entre otros.Le gusta lo que hace, pues le permite tener tiempo para poder estar al cuidado de su hogar, además que desde que empezó con su negocio le está yendo bien en su economía, ya que tiene ingresos para su hogar, desea seguir creciendo, por eso tiene en mente ampliar sus ventas. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado 500 soles, comprará abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en: Roldan is 43 years old. He is the father of 3 children who are now adults and he lives in his own home with his wife at his side. Roldan works growing bananas, yuca and other regional products. For a long time he suffered from many setbacks in his life because he could not find work after people abandoned his city due to fears of terrorism. Because of this situation he decided to begin a new project 13 years ago with the desire to succeed growing alternative products provided by the government such as cocoa, bananas, and coffee, among others.  He likes what he does because it allows him to spend time caring for his home. Moreover, since he began his business he has done well economically because now he receives earnings for his household. He wishes to continue growing his business because he he wishes to increase his sales. This is his first loan with Kiva and he is grateful for the financial support that he is receiving to get ahead. In addition, he promises to make his payments on time. With the amount he is seeking of $200 he will purchase organic fertilizer for his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es: Nelson tiene 49  años de edad, es padre soltero de dos hijas con quienes vive en su casa propia. Nelson se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles tales como arroz, leche , conservas de pescado , entre otros. Nelson al principio no queria poner ningún negocio ya que estaba muy afecado por la separación con su esposa pero logro superar este percance con el apoyo de sus dos hijas quienes lo motivaron a poner su tienda. Espera que su tienda sea mas grande para así poder brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante. Nelson  desea invertir los S/.1000.00 en la compra de productos comestibles tales como leche, arroz , conservas , entre otros.
texts.en: Nelson is 49 years old. He is a single father of two daughters, with whom he lives in his own house. Nelson sells grocery products such as rice, milk, and canned fish, among other items. At first, Nelson did not want to set up any business, since he was very affected by his separation from his wife, but he managed to overcome this misfortune with the support of his two daughters, who motivated him to set up his store. He hopes that his store will become larger so that he can then offer the best to his family. This is his first loan with Kiva, and he feels grateful for the financial support that he will receive to advance. Nelson wants to invest the 1000 PEN in the purchase of grocery products such as milk, rice, and canned goods, among other items.

loans.use: to buy grocery products such as milk, rice, and canned goods, among other items

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is married with four children. Two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a retail shop and has been in this business for 10 years. 

Allen applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Uganda shilling from MCDTSACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, jerycans of cooking oil, and rice. She generates additional income through a beauty salon and selling pied water. She sells both on retail and wholesale 7 days a week.  Her major business challenges include transportation, defaulters, and seasonality. 

Allen wants to own a fully stocked retail shop and also wants to educate her children up to the university level. She resides in a family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap,  jerycans of cooking oil, and rice.

loans.name: Theophine

texts.en:
Please meet Theophine from Liberia. She lives and works in Nimba County. Nimba is one of the most resource rich areas in Liberia producing minerals such as iron ore. The county shares a border with both Cote D’Ivoire and Guinea. As a result, many people on business pass through the area bringing lots of trade. It is also the second most populous area in Liberia. 

Theophine has completed the 12th grade and is unmarried. Her fiancée is not working. They have two children, ages 2 and 7. Only one is in school, and they all live at home. Theophine has had a table business which sells fashion slippers in the local market for two years now. On average, she works ten hours at her business. She started her business by selling bread for her mother. She transports her merchandise by taxi. She cites the high price of goods as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is that she is popular. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more fashion slippers for her business. In the future, she would like to own a car. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more fashion slippers for her business.

loans.name: Hannington

texts.en: Hannington is a married man. He describes himself as aggressive. He will use the KES 12,900 loan to buy a gas cooker. He hopes that in the future, he will be stable and successful. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans of KES 100,000 were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a gas cooker

loans.name: Tutu

texts.en:
Tutu is 21 years old and lives in Ganta City, one of the most talked about cities in Nimba County (the second most populous county in Liberia). She is married, and her husband is not working. They have two children aged 1 and 8. Only one is presently attending school, and they all live at home. 

For the past three years she has been selling soft drinks. She enjoys her business because of the profit she makes every day. 

She dropped out of schooling in the 9th grade. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase additional soft drinks for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Luckystar

texts.en: Luckystar is a 41-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 2 to 21 years old. She describes herself to be God fearing and hopeful. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy water pipes for an irrigation system for her farm. She hopes that in the future, she will have a well-developed family, both physically and spiritually. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully

loans.use: to buy water pipes

loans.name: Nazrijon

texts.ru: Назричон несколько лет назад потеряла своего мужа. После смерти мужа она осталась без кормильца с 6 детьми. Ей 56 лет. Она трудолюбивая и чистосердечная женщина. Назричон более 10 лет занимается скотоводством. Она живет в сельской местности и поэтому для нее есть все условия, чтобы развевать бизнес. Назричон откармливает скот дома. Она имеет 4 коровы и 2 барана. Она встает рано утром и начинает свой день с того, что она доит коровы. Она продает молоко и кефир соседям, а также после несколько месяцев скот, которого она откармливала. Назричону постепенно помогают дети, так как они уже совершеннолетние. Она хочет сыграть свадьбу своего младшего ребенка, которому 21 года, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Nazrijon lost her husband a few years ago.  After her husband passed away, she was left alone with six children to feed.  She is now 56 years old, and a hardworking and honest woman.  

Nazrijon has been involved in raising livestock for more than ten years.  She lives in a rural area which offers ideal conditions to develop her animal husbandry business.  She fattens livestock at home.  She currently owns four cows and two sheep.  She wakes up early in the morning and starts her day by milking her cows.  She sells her cows' milk and kefir (fermented milk drink) to her neighbors.  After a few months she also resells the livestock which she has fattened.  

Nazrijon is continuing to support her children as they are becoming adults.  She wants to hold a wedding ceremony for her youngest child, who is now 21 years old, but she doesn't have the money to do so.  She is requesting a loan of 7,500 somoni to pay for the wedding party.  She is relying on your kindness and mercy.

loans.use: to pay for her child's wedding party.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel, de 41 años, está casado y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Miguel consiste en la venta de plátanos, Yucas y otros productos de su terreno agrícola, durante mucho tiempo no tuvo un trabajo estable, y por esta razón no tenia suficiente dinero para su hogar, es por eso que desde hace un 12 años decidió empezar un nuevo proyecto con ganas de sobresalir. Pensó que sus amigos, vecinos o familiares desearían comprar productos de su terreno dependiendo de la temporada en la que se encuentren, es así que inicio su negocio que ahora le da muy buenos resultados. Le gusta lo que hace, pues le permite tener tiempo para poder estar al cuidado de su vivienda, además que desde que empezó con su negocio le está yendo bien en su economía, ya que tiene ingresos para su hogar, desea seguir creciendo, por eso tiene en mente ampliar sus ventas. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado de S/.500 soles comprará abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Miguel, 41, is married and has two children who live with him in his own house.  Miguel's job is selling bananas, yuca, and other products from his crops.

For a long time he didn't have a stable job, so he didn't have enough money for his household.  This is why he decided to start a new project 12 years ago, with a desire to get ahead.  He thought his friends, neighbors, or relatives would want to buy products from his fields, depending on the season.  This is how he started his business, which gives him very good results now.

He likes what he does because it allows him to have time to be able to take care of his house.  Also, his finances have been going well since he started his business because he has income for his household.  He wants to continue to grow so he plans to expand his sales.

This is his first Kiva loan and he's grateful for the financial support so he can get ahead.  He promises to make his payments punctually.

With the requested amount of 500 soles [PEN] he'll buy organic soil amendments for his fields.

loans.use: to buy organic soil amendments

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha is 35 years old and she lives in Nimba, a County in Liberia that shares a border with Guinea and Cote D’Ivoire.  Because of its status as a border county, trade is the primary activity in the region.  It also has the second highest population in Liberia.
Oretha is married and has two children aged 2 and 9.  Only one is presently in school and the two of them live at home. She stopped her education at 1st grade due to some financial problems, according to her parents. For the past ten years she has been selling rice, pepper, oil, vita, onions, etc. in the local market. She has a lot of customers and makes lots of profit every day.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, vita, onions, etc. for her business. She plans to expand her business and send her children to quality schools.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, vita (a locally sold drink), onions, etc. for her business

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a married man with 6 children.  He is a hard working man and he has a very big coffee plantation from which he gets income to meet his family needs. He has requested a loan for UGX 1,500,000 to help him get workers who will assist him in coffee harvesting this season. He says that if he doesn’t get workers most of his seedlings will be lost in the garden.  It is from these yields that he hopes to get a lot of profits. These profits will assist him to educate his children and repay the loan. He thanks Kiva lenders through Ugafode for helping to lift the rural people out of poverty.

loans.use: To hire labourers to pick (harvest) coffee

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis es un hombre de 27 años de edad, que anteriormente se dedicaba a trabajar como obrero de construcción, pero por la inestabilidad que se maneja en este campo de acción, decidió buscar opciones para generar ingresos de manera independiente, fue así como inició su negocio, donde ofrece el servicio de alquiler de video juegos por horas y además vendía artículos de papelería, actividad que viene realizando desde hace 3 años y que poco a poco ha ido mejorando, pues hoy en día también presta el servicio de café internet. De esta forma ha logrado generar ingresos para solventar sus gastos personales y familiares. El cliente es un hombre carismático, activo y muy trabajador, siempre está en busca de opciones que le permitan seguir avanzando. Esto lo motiva para solicitar el crédito que invertirá en la compra de 2 computadores, con los cuales podrá ampliar sus capacidad para satisfacer la demanda actual de su negocio ya que le ha ido muy bien en el sector donde se encuentra ubicado; esto se reflejará en el incremento de sus ingresos por ventas. De esta manera, Luis desea hacer crecer su negocio y poder brindar más oportunidades de empleo a sus familiares, mejorando así la calidad de vida de los miembros de su familia y la propia.
texts.en:
Luis is a 27-year-old man who used to work as a construction worker.  But due to the lack of stability in this line of work, he decided to look for other ways to make money in an independent way.  For this reason, he started his own business, where he offered his services loaning video games by the hour and also selling paper products.  He has had this business for 3 years and it has been improving little by little and now he runs an internet cafe.  In this way, he has been able to earn his own income so he can take care of his personal and family expenses.

He is charismatic, active, and very hardworking.  He is always looking for ways to keep progressing.  This motivated him to ask for a loan, which he will use to buy 2 computers.  He will use these computers to expand his ability to satisfy his business' demand, since it has been going very well where he lives.  This is reflected in the increase in sales that he has seen.  In this way, Luis wants to help his business grow and be able to offer more employment opportunities to his family members.  In this way, he can improve the quality of life of the members of his family.

loans.use: buy 2 computers.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is married with four children. She has received some schooling, until the end of junior high school. She used to sell palm fruit but currently, Ama  sells cooking utensils in Ebubonku (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this industry for about two years now. Her husband is a driver. Ama's  income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. Ama will use the loan to increase her existing cooking utensils capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, she plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: increase her existing cooking utensils  capacity.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en: Evaline is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as ambitious. She will use the KES 8,700 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. Her family faces the challenge of a lack of enough water storage facilities. She hopes that in the future she will purchase a larger water tank. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
After graduating from middle school, Abena decided to set up her own ‘banku’ selling business.  ('Banku' is a traditional Ghanaian dish, made with a fermented maize and cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth, whitish, consistent paste). She prepares her ‘banku’ on her own and proceeds to sell it in Ebukonku (near Cape Coast).

With over 11 years of experience, Abena is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited by a lack of funding. As a result, she plans to use this loan to purchase more maize and cassava, which will enable her to prepare and sell more of her tasty ‘banku.’ She aims to use the profits from her business to help her husband (who is a pensioner) with the upkeep of their house whilst, ensuring that their three children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase a bigger quantity of maize and cassava, so she can prepare and sell more 'banku' to customers

loans.name: Quy

texts.en: Quy was born in 1994. He lives in Thai Binh Province. His major is Electronics Industry at Ha Noi University of Industry (http://haui.edu.vn/en). His course lasts three years and he will graduate in 2015. His education fee is subsidized by his parent. Quy plans to find a part-time job to have money to pay for his education fee. Quy’s family has five members. He is the first person in his family who graduated from high school and has a higher education. His father is a construction worker and his mother is a breeder to earn a living. His family’s income is about 8,500,000 VND per month. He likes his major because this major is consistent with his hobby. He wants to follow to the end of this university’s course. He understands that learning helps him have qualifications to get a high-paid job to afford things for his family and improve his family’s living standard. He wants to borrow 10,206,000 VND to pay for his education fee. If he can't access this loan, his studying will have to be interrupted. He appreciates the help of people all around the world who are raising funds for this kind of program. It has been supported a lot for the education of students in Vietnam. He also hopes this program could be expanded more to help more students.

loans.use: to pay for his education fee.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo, de 29 años de edad, es un hombre con muchas ganas de progresar y salir adelante, además de ser amable y cordial con las personas. Está casado con Sara quien es ama de casa y madre de sus 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Arturo es la venta de ladrillos artesanales. Prepara estos ladrillos  en su casa y la venta lo realiza a sus amigos, vecinos, familiares y otras personas. Se inicio revendiendo ladrillos logrando hacer crecer su capital, luego decidió elaborar el mismo estos ladrillos, y hasta el momento lo realiza junto a su hermano. Se decidió a empezar este negocio por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso adicional para apoyar a su esposa pues los ingresos que obtenía anteriormente no le alcanzaban para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.Por tanto, viendo los buenos resultados que tiene, desea en un futuro abrir un negocio de un restaurante pues le gusta la cocina. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles comprará materiales como arena, pegamento , entre otros para la elaboración de sus ladrillos.
texts.en: Arturo is 29 years old. He is a man with a lot of desire to improve his life and to get ahead, in addition to being friendly and polite with other people.He is married to Sara who is a housewife and the mother of his two children with whom he lives in their own home. Arturo is employed selling homemade bricks. He prepares these bricks in his home and he makes sales to his friends,  neighbors, family members and other people. He started his business by reselling bricks which allowed him to increase his capital. Later, he decided to make the bricks himself and he currently does this together with his brother. He decided to begin this business because of his need for additional earnings to support his wife because his earlier wages were not able to cover the expenses of their home. In light of the good results he has had he desires to open a restaurant as a business in the future because he likes to cook. This is his first loan through Kiva and he feels grateful for the financial support he is receiving to get ahead. Moreover, he promises to make his payments on time. WIth the amount of $550 that he is seeking he will buy materials like sand, and cement, among others to manufacture his bricks.

loans.use: to purchase sand and cement and other materials for the manufacture of bricks.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a married woman. She has 8 children. She describes herself as focused. She sells cereals (grains) to earn a living. She will use the KES 26,500 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. Her family faces the challenge of a lack of enough water. She hopes that in the future she will expand her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raúl, de 20 años, es un hombre  amable y muy trabajador, está casado con Amelia con quien vive en su casa propia. Raúl tiene un taller de mecánica que siempre se encuentra abierta desde muy temprano, es por eso que sus múltiples clientes van en busca de la reparación de sus  vehículos ya que saben que serán atendidos de buena manera. Su negocio está ubicado en su hogar y tiene un promedio de 2 años en el mismo. Le gusta su negocio pues no tiene que salir mucho de casa  y puede apoyar en lo que su mamá necesite.
Agradece mucho  el apoyo que le brinda su esposa. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará herramientas para realizar su trabajo y también repuestos como llantas, ejes, pernos, entre otros para poder ofrecer mayor cantidad de productos.
texts.en: Raúl is 20 years old. He is a friendly and hardworking man. He is married to Amelia who he lives with in their own home. Raúl has a mechanic's garage that one can always find open starting very early in the morning. It is because of this that his many clients come in search of vehicle repairs from him,  because they know that they will be treated well. His business is located at his home and has spent 2 years working on it. He likes his business because he does not have to leave his home a lot. He also promises to make his payments on time. With the amount of $550 that he is seeking he will buy tools to complete his work as well as parts like wheels, bolts and shafts, among others, and he will also be able to offer a greater quantity of products.

loans.use: to buy tools and parts like tires, bolts and shafts, among others.

loans.name: Auntie Ama

texts.en:
Auntie Ama is divorced and has two children. Having successfully graduated from secondary school, Auntie is now an established businesswoman. She sells second-hand clothes in Ebubonku (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about 27 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Auntie Ama uses her income to provide for the entire family.

Auntie Ama will use the loan to purchase more second-hand clothes, and this will help her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Auntie Ama plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, thereby adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase more second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJEKAFO, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 45 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Yolla, commune de Guégnaka, préfecture de Dioîla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiment, de l’habillement, du savon et lait.                                                             
Les femmes du groupe DJEKAFO sont à leur treizième  prêt solidaire. Elles sont tous des habituées du programme de Soro. Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées. 
La cliente Gnakale  la première personne à gauche compte acheter 4sacs de graine de néré pour la fabrication du Soumbala et 45kg d’arachide.  Après transformation de ces produits en condiment, la vente se fait au marché et à la maison chaque semaine. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 18.000FCFA. Ce bénéfice sera réutilisé dans l’achat de condiment si possible en augmentant la quantité d’achat.
texts.en:
The group DJEKAFO is composed of married women, who average 45 years of age and three children each, all living in traditional extended families in the village of Yolla, Commune de Guégneka, Préfecture de Dioîla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in condiments, clothing, soap, and milk. 

The women of the group DJEKAFO are on their 13th solidarity loan. They are all regular clients of the Soro program. The money will be used to purchase their merchandise, as mentioned above.

This client, Gnakale, who is the first person at the left, intends to purchase 4 sacks of néré seeds to make 'soumbala' (pounded and fermented seeds or beans used in making traditional foods) and 45 kg of peanuts. After making her condiments, she sells them at the market and out of the house each week. She plans on making a monthly profit of 18,000 francs CFA which will be reused to purchase food if possible while increasing her purchasing power.

loans.use: to purchase néré seeds to make 'soumbala' (used in cooking traditional foods).

loans.name: Bramwell

texts.en:
Bramwell is 35 years old from Nakuru. He is married to Faith, who owns several businesses and therefore produces additional income for the family. He has two children aged sevem and two years old respectively.

He is in the business of selling computer games and accessories, which he has been running for the past six years. He has applied for a loan of KES 20,000 from Kadet Ltd. for his second loan and he intends to use it for the expansion of his business as well as to add more stock.

His hope and dream for the future is to be a self sufficient man.

loans.use: To expand his business of computer games and accessories

loans.name: Haidar

texts.ru: Хайдар житель района Зафаробод - это на севере Таджикистана. Он занимается животноводством. Ему 25 лет. Он женат и отец двоих детей. Хайдар разводит крупнорогатый скот для продажи. Ему было 20 лет когда он начал данный бизнес и по сей день продолжает его. Прибыль с бизнеса является единственным источником их семейного дохода. В хозяйстве Хайдара сейчас осталось только две коровы с теленком. Он хочет увеличить поголовье своего скота и с такой целью обратился за кредитом. На сумму кредита Хайдар намерен купить шесть голов коров и телят, а также 250 килограмм жмыха. Он откармливает скот в течение 60-65 дней и после этого продает с наценкой на скотном рынке. Он занимается своим бизнесом с удовольствием.
texts.en: Haidar is a resident of Zafarobod, in the north of Tajikistan.  He raises cattle for sale.  He is 25 years old, married and is the father to two children.  He was 20 years old when he started his business and he has been working in it until this day.  This enterprise provides the sole source of income for his family.  Currently, Haidar has only two cows and a calf.  He is asking for a loan to expand his herd by purchasing six cows and calves, as well as 250 kilograms of cake.  Over 60-65 days, he fattens the livestock, and then sells them at a premium on the market.  He greatly enjoys working in his business.

loans.use: To purchase 6 heads of cows and calves, as well as 250 kilograms of cake

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJANTOYERELA, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 46 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Yolla, commune de Guégnaka, préfecture de Dioîla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, des galettes des céréales et du riz. Les femmes du groupe DJANTOYERELA sont à leur dixième prêt solidaire. Elles sont tous des habituées du programme de Soro. Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées. 
Avec ce prêt,  la cliente Kadia  la personne à gauche compte acheter 3 sacs de mil, 50 litres d’huile,  2 chargements de fagot et un kg de sucre pour faire des galettes. Les galettes ainsi préparées sont vendues en détail et au comptant à une clientèle diverse et variée.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 75.000FCFA par mois. Une partie de ce bénéfice sera réutilisée dans l’activité et l’autre dans la prise en charge de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The group DJANTOYERELA is composed of married women, who average 46 years of age and three children each, all living in traditional extended families in the village of Yolla, Commune de Guégneka, Préfecture de Dioîla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in condiments, rice, and galettes made from grains. 

The women of the group DJANTOYERELA are on their tenth solidarity loan. They are all regular clients of the Soro program. The money will be used to purchase their merchandise, as mentioned above.

With this loan, this client, Kadia, who is at the left, intends to purchase 3 sacks of millet, 50 liters of oil, 2 loads of kindling, and a kilo of sugar to make galettes. The galettes prepared in this way are sold retail to a diverse and varied customer base paying cash.

She plans on making a profit of 75,000 francs CFA per month. Part of the profits will be reused in her business, and the other part will be for supporting her children.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making galettes in her restaurant.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a Kiva borrower. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water that will benefit five family members. They face a challenge of lack of enough water storage facilities. They will be able to store enough water for domestic use. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Khadmala

texts.en: Khadmala is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as visionary and ambitious. She operates rental houses to earn an income. She will use the KES 21,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. Her family faces a challenge of lack of enough water.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Kemah

texts.en:
Kemah lives in Montserrado County, where the capital city of Liberia is located. It is well-known as the commercial heart of Liberia. Kemah is 42 years old. She did not attend school. She is married and has three children, aged between 5 and 22. They live at home, and only two are in school.

For the past seven years, Kemah has been selling charcoal in the community market. She started this business with help from her husband, and she learned this way of selling from him. She spends eight hours per day with her business. Most of the time, she uses the bus to get her goods to her place of business. She said, "I am a businesswoman, and I like my business because it gives me more profit."

Kemah is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more charcoal. This will enable her to increase her sales. She wants to earn more money, to build a house. She appreciates Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal and increase her sales.

loans.name: Yeredon Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe YEREDON, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 34 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Sanakorodjeda commune de Banco, préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de fruits et des légumes. Les femmes du groupe YEREDON sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Avec ce prêt,  la cliente Magnine,  la troisième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises. Elle  compte acheter 3 régimes de  banane avec son argent dans les plantations du village de Sanakorodjeda et Koula. Elle vend sa banane à Baou Foulala et à Banco. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen 24.000FCFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permet d’aider son mari dans les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The group YEREDON is composed of married women, who average 34 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional extended families in the village of Sanakorodjeda, Commune de Banco, Préfecture de Dioîla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in grains, fruits, and vegetables. The women of the group YEREDON are on their second solidarity loan. 

With this loan, this client, Magnine, who is sitting third from the right, intends to use her money to purchase 3 bunches of bananas from the plantations of the village Sanakorodjeda et Koula. She sells the bananas in Baou Foulala and in Banco.

She plans on making an average profit of 24,000 francs CFA per month. This profit will enable her to help her husband to cover family expenses

loans.use: to purchase fruit to sell

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DANAYA, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 48 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Yolla, commune de Guégnaka, préfecture de Dioîla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments,  de l’habillement, des galettes des céréales et du lait. Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur dix huitième prêt solidaire. La cliente Minata  la personne assise au milieu compte acheter deux rouleaux de pagnes traditionnels et trois douzaines de fil à coudre. Elle fait des dessins particuliers sur les pagnes et ensuite elle les met sur le marché. L’achat vente est fait chaque semaine. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 34.000FCFA. Une partie de ce bénéfice sera réutilisé dans l’achat de pagne et l’autre dans l’achat de petits ruminants.
texts.en:
The group DANAYA is composed of married women, who average 48 years of age and three children each, all living in traditional extended families in the village of Yolla, Commune de Guégneka, Préfecture de Dioîla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in condiments, clothing, milk, and galettes made from grains. The women of the group DANAYA are on their 18th solidarity loan. 

This client, Minata, who is sitting in the middle, intends to purchase 2 rolls of traditional 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and 3 dozen [spools] of thread. She makes individual designs on the 'pagne' cloth and then puts them up for sale. She buys and sells each week. 

She plans on making a monthly profit of 34,000 francs CFA. Part of the profits will be reused to purchase 'pagne' cloth, and the other part will be for purchasing small ruminants.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making traditional 'pagne' cloth to sell

loans.name: Kelly Yurley

texts.es: Kelly es una mujer de 24 años de edad, que se ha dedicado a laborar en el campo de la belleza, gracias a las enseñanzas de algunos familiares que ya llevan trayectoria en la labor. Actualmente tiene su propia sala de belleza, que inició con el apoyo de sus padres y con la cual ha logrado generar ingresos para aportar a la economía de su hogar. La cliente es una joven emprendedora, enérgica y dedicada a su negocio, pues es su principal fuente de ingresos, por lo cual lucha incansablemente para lograr que sea reconocido en el sector. Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de activos fijos (vapor ozono, camilla, termobag, ultrasonido) ya que desea acreditar su sala de belleza, ampliar su portafolio de servicios y, poco a poco convertirla en un spa, con lo que obtendrá mayor número de clientes que le generarán mejores ingresos. De esta manera desea avanzar y hacer realidad su principal sueño que es tener su casa propia en un futuro a mediano plazo.
texts.en:
Kelly, 24, works in a beauty salon thanks to some relatives who already work in that field.  Currently she has her own salon that she started with the support of her parents.  She has managed to generate income to contribute to the household finances.

Kelly's an enterprising and energetic young woman who's dedicated to her business.  It's her main source of income so she strives tirelessly to achieve recognition in the field.

She's requesting the current loan to invest in buying fixed assets (a vapor ozone steamer, a table, a thermo bag, and an ultrasound machine).

She wants to get accreditation for her salon, expand her portfolio of services, and convert it into a spa little by little.  This way she'll acquire more customers, which will generate better income for her.  She wants to advance and achieve her main dream of having her own house in the medium term.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives at Sinkor, in Montserrado County, which living area is almost like the capital city of Liberia. It is well-known as the well laid out place in Liberia. She 39 years old, married, and has four children who were born between 1991 and 2004.  Her children are in school and live at home.

Since 2007 she has been selling coal by the bag, in the community market. She started this business with help from her husband, who works as a security guard. She learned this way of selling from her mother. She sells for as long as nine hours per day at her business. Most of the time, she uses a pickup to get her goods to her place of business. She likes her business, because it makes her popular, she says.

Josephine is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more 50 bags of coal. This will enable her to increase her sales. She wants to earn more money, so she will be able to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more 50 bags of coal and increase her sales.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth lives in Sinkor in Montserrado County, the capital city of Liberia. It is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. She is 40 years old, married with two children ages 10 and 18, both of whom are in school. Since 1992 she has been running a table market where she sells rice, pepper, bitter ball, vita, and other items. She started this business with help from her mother and learned this way of selling from her too. She likes her business because it gives her more profits and makes her popular. She is requesting a loan to buy more pepper, bitter ball, rice, vita, and other items for her business. She wants to get more money to build a house and buy a car.

loans.use: to buy more pepper, bitter ball, rice, vita, and other items for her business

loans.name: Korto

texts.en: Korto lives in Montserrado County in the capital city of Liberia, which is well known as the country's main commercial city. She 29 year old and unmarried with three children between 7 and 10 years old. Her children are in school and live at home. For the past 4 Korto has been selling cookies and banana in her community, a business she started with the help from her mother, who taught her this way of selling. Korto like her business because it provides her a profit. She is requesting a loan to buy more cookies and bananas for her business. She wishes to get money to educate all her children and own a house.

loans.use: to buy cookies and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Pompeo

texts.es:
Pompeo, de 37 años es un hombre amable y bueno. Está separado y es padre de 03 hijos, con quienes vive en su casa propia. Pompeo se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles como arroz, harina, huevos, entre otros. Cada mañana se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus clientes muy cordialmente. Lleva realizando éste negocio hace más de 04 años y le ha permitido tener un ingreso adicional ya que también trabaja como personal administrativo en una municipalidad de la ciudad. Le está yendo bien en su negocio y al mismo tiempo en su trabajo ya que percibe dos ingresos y eso le permite poder tener algunas comodidades en su hogar al mismo tiempo de apoyar a sus hijos quienes aun están estudiando y necesitan de bastantes materiales para poder realizar sus estudios de manera adecuada. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de S/.1000 soles, comprará productos comestibles en general como arroz, harina, huevos, entre otros.
texts.en: Pompeo is a 37 years old friendly and good man. He is separated and he is the father of three children with whom he lives in his own home. Pompeo works selling groceries like rice, flour and eggs, among others. Each morning he gets up very early to attend to his clients in a very friendly manner. He has been running this business for more than 4 years and it has allowed him to earn additional wages because he also works as an administrative professional in the municipal government of the city. His business is going well, as is his job, now that he earns two wages. This allows him to have a few comforts in his home and at the same time to support his children who are in school and need significant materials to be able to complete their studies in an adequate way. This is his first loan with Kiva and he feels grateful for the financial support that he is receiving to get ahead. In addition, he promises to make his payments on time. With the amount of $375 that he is seeking he will buy general groceries like rice, flour and eggs, among others.

loans.use: to buy groceries like rice, flour and eggs, among others.

loans.name: John Jairo

texts.es: Jhon tiene 43 años de edad, es padre de 2 hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Hace 18 años se trasladó de su pueblo natal y se radicó en la ciudad, con el objetivo de buscar nuevos horizontes y nuevas oportunidades para progresar. Allí, comenzó a laborar en una empresa, pero luego de 4 años, vio que el salario que ganaba no le alcanzaba para solventar las necesidades de su hogar, por lo que comenzó a vender frutas en una carreta los domingos, poco a poco fue consiguiendo clientes y le comenzó a ir mejor, por lo que decidió retirarse de la empresa y dedicarse de lleno a la venta de frutas, más adelante consiguió un punto fijo donde ubicar la carreta y allí ya lleva 14 años, trabajando todos los días desde muy temprano en la mañana y durante el día cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo mayor.
