Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 1,064,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Abdul K. requires a loan in order to purchase tons of iron rods and bags of cement. 

In the future, Abdul K. plans to expand his business and give his children a good education. Shortage in supply of goods is his challenge. His business requires a larger amount of capital, and he is hoping to get subsequent loans to boost his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase tons of iron rods and bags of cement.

loans.name: Fatmata M.

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Fatmata M. She is married and has five children, aged 23, 19, 16, 13 and 9 years; four are school-going children. In 1991, Fatmata M. established her cooking utensils business. She began her business because after school hours, she used to help her mother in her business. Thinking that doing business is more of an advantage, she decided to drop out of school. Her mother did not advise her to continue her education; she encouraged her because she needed more hands in running the business. 

She got married at a younger age and set up her own business. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 605,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Fatmata M. requires a loan in order to purchase cartons of enamel pans and other utensils. In the future, Fatmata M. plans to give her children a quality education and open a shop. As competition is very high, the loan will help her manage her business effectively. She is looking forward to acquiring subsequent loans. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of enamel pans and other utensils.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for construction materials to fix his home.

loans.name: Daniel Cristobal

texts.en:
Daniel, 27, is a resident of Pucallpa (“red earth” in Quechua), which is located on the bank of the Ucayali River in the Amazon rainforest of Peru. 

Currently, Daniel works for the provincial government and recently completed his post-secondary studies in administration and accounting. Daniel’s main focus and goal is to rise in the ranks within the government, something that he cannot achieve until he is officially granted his university degree. To finally receive his degree, Daniel must pay additional fees, which is why he is taking out this loan. He is extremely grateful to Kiva lenders for their support, as it motivates him to continue working hard to achieve his goals and become a successful professional.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado (Kuña Kyre´y ) está en su ciclo número (1) del programa de comité de mujeres, surgió gracias a promociones realizada en la zona y también gracias a las ganas de crecer que tienen todas.
La Sra. Pastora, es la Presidenta del grupo. Ella alienta a las demás compañeras a luchar por sus objetivos  para llegar al éxito deseado. Tiene como actividad “Cría de Pollo” y de esa forma tiene los ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia. Es una persona muy entusiasta y con grandes ganas de ir mejorando.
La Sra. Solicita  este crédito para la compra de Pollos para criar, esto le ayudará a mantener una actividad estable, que le permitirá aumentar su ingreso y elevar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
The group called "Kuña Kyre´y"  is in their first cycle with Women’s Committee program. It was created thanks to promotions put on in their area and the desire of the members to grow. Pastora is the president of the group. She encouraged the others to fight for their goals, in order to achieve the desired results. 

Her business is raising chickens. From this she generates the income she needs to help support her family. She is a very enthusiastic individual with a strong desire to get ahead. Pastora is requesting this loan to buy chickens to raise. This will help her keep her business activity going which will allow her to increase her revenues and raise the standard of living for her whole family.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise.

loans.name: Safira

texts.en: Safira is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, soy sauce, vinegar and other groceries. Safira has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from selling bananas. Safira has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store such as canned goods, eggs, soy sauce, vinegar, and other groceries.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en: Beverly is 48-years-old and married with six children; three of whom are in school. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Beverly is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed. She has been raising livestock for five years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her livestock activity.

loans.name: Leny Joy

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, five of whom are in school, Leny Joy works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Leny Joy is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net for her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net for her business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is 27-years-old and married with one child. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Vilma is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Vilma has been pig fattening for three years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Auring

texts.en: Auring is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like spices, meat, vegetables, etc. for her food vending business. She has been in this business for five years. Auring earns more income from her general store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like spices, meat, vegetables, etc. for her food vending business.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 51-years-old and has six children. She is married and has three children who are in school. Adelaida is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs. She has been in the pig fattening business for 11 years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. 

In the future, Adelaida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: Analiza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business. Analiza has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from buying and selling dried fish. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 36 years old and married with three children who are in school.

Nilda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requests a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc. to sell.

Nilda has already borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Nilda aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, milk, sugar, and canned goods, etc. to sell

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Liza works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing. Liza is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Liza has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

loans.name: Azenith

texts.en:
Azenith is 31 years old and married. She works hard to increase her family's income. Azenith runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell such as canned goods, milk, sugar, shampoo, etc. Azenith has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Azenith would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as canned goods, milk, sugar, shampoo, etc. for her general store business.

loans.name: 3.17.335.5.thiệu Tâm Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hạnh has a service business of taking photographs. She is requesting a loan to purchase instruments to maintain the wedding preparation service shop. Hạnh is 29-years-old and married with two children. Hạnh is the group leader of the 3.17.335.5.Thiệu Tâm solidarity group, which consists of six members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

This is Hạnh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Hạnh has been involved in this business for five years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Hạnh hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase instruments to maintain the wedding preparation service shop.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 58-years-old and widowed with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a direct selling business of Avon products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of these products to sell.

Irene has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running this business for 15 years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear clothes. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of Avon products to sell for her retail business.

loans.name: 3.17.337.4.thiệu Tâm Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương has a retail business selling animal feed. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry feed to resell. She is 44-years-old and married with two children. Hương is the group leader of the 3.17.337.4.Thiệu Tâm solidarity group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents. This is Hương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hương hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed to resell for her retail business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business. Rosita has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from coconut wine vending.

Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: 3.17.338.2.thiệu Tâm Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lê  has a manufacturing business making iron furniture. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make iron and aluminum goods to sell. Lê  is 23 years old and she is married with 1 child. She is the group leader of the 3.17.338.2.Thiệu Tâm solidarity group, which consists of four members. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent. This is Lê's  first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for two years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lê  hopes to buy land, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make iron and aluminum goods to sell for her manufacturing activity.

loans.name: Teresuta

texts.en:
Teresuta is 53 years old and married with four children.

Teresuta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requests a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, soap, coffee, eggs, etc..

Teresuta has already borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Teresuta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, soap, coffee, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is 44 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Azucena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Azucena has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future Azucena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: 3.17.336.7.thiệu Tâm Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Năm operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell. Năm is 43 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 3.17.336.7.Thiệu Tâm solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents. 

This is Năm's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Năm hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell for her food selling business.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
This is Consolacion. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Consolacion hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is 55 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school, Corazon works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as soap, sugar, noodles, egg, canned goods, etc. Corazon has been in this business for two years. In the future, Corazon would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as soap, sugar, noodles, egg, canned goods, etc. for her general store.

loans.name: Donesa

texts.en: Donesa works hard to support her family. Donesa has a corn vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of corn to sell. She has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. In the future, Donesa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of corn to sell for her food selling business.

loans.name: Buenconsejo

texts.en:
Buenconsejo is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell for her coconut wine vending business.

Buenconsejo has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from direct selling Avon, MSE, and personal collection products.

Buenconsejo has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 41 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school.

Nancy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell.

Nancy has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the coconut wine vending business for 21 years and also earns an income from a general store.

Nancy aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Gankhad

texts.en: Gankhad, 34 years old, lives with his wife and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working at a building company since 2009. His wife has the position of bookkeeper at a vacuum insulated windows manufacturing factory. Their children go to high school. The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years so he decided to make some repairs and an extension. For this cause, he is requesting a loan of 6,200,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, planks, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, he will make renovations and an extension to his house thus creating a comfortable and warm place. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating and release fewer pollutants into the atmosphere.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Ching

texts.en: Ching is married and lives in Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur with her family. Her husband serves as a barangay councilor in the village. She operates a "sari-sari" store to make a living. In 2011, she joined Gata Daku MPC and successfully repaid her previous loans that she used as additional capital for the business. She borrowed a new loan of 47,000 to purchase additional items like dried fish, canned goods, sugar, noodles, rice and livestock feed to sell. She is thankful to GDMPC that she has gained access to microfinance services after joining. She plans to save a portion of her revenue for emergencies and to have a better living in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like dried fish, canned goods, sugar, noodles, rice and livestock feed to sell

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Flor works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from meat vending. Flor is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy meat, vegetables, fish, spices, etc. for her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, fish, spices, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is 50 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a buy-and-sell sacks business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks to sell. She has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks to sell for her retail business.

loans.name: Ma. Divinia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Ma. Divinia works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Ma. Divinia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, soft drinks, groceries, etc. for her general store business.

Ma. Divinia has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, soft drinks, groceries, etc. in her general store.

loans.name: Enma Lulu

texts.es: Enma es una mujer emprendedora de 60 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijas bajo su cargo de 38 y 14 años, su negocio es una pulpería ubicada en su domicilio desde hace 10 años, Su esposo le ayuda a despachar. Tiene 1 año de ser cliente de la institución, el crédito lo invertirá en comprar granos básicos por quintal como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, jabones, papel higiénico, pastillas, café, leche, gaseosa, etc.
texts.en:
Enma, 60, is an enterprising woman.  She's married and has two children in her care, ages 38 and 14.

Her business is a grocery store located in her house for the last 10 years.  Her husband helps her.  She has been a client of the institution for a year.

She'll invest the loan in buying basic grains by the quintal such as rice, sugar, beans, oil, soap, toilet paper, pills, coffee, milk, soda, etc.

loans.use: to buy provisions

loans.name: Jargalsaikhan

texts.en:
Mrs. Jargalsaikhan, 50 years old, lives with her son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in an old house on a plot of land. Her elder son lives separately from her as he got married. Her younger son is a third year student at university and is currently working at a furniture making facility as an assistant. She herself has been working as a cook at a cafeteria for two years. She is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase building materials such as shingles and fiberglass. 

The house roof has become so vulnerable it doesn't protect from rain drops or snow. After renovation she, together with her son, will live in a comfortable and warm place. They will also burn less coal for heating, thus releasing less pollutants and contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase building materials.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the needed products and grocery items for her variety store. Her income from the business assisted in the education of her children and their household expenses.

She would like to apply for another 16,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. The profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Teresita hopes that her business will continue to be successful and dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur with her family. She has three children who needs her support financially and morally. Her husband is a carpenter, and she manages a retail store to make a living. She successfully repaid her previous loans from Gata Daku MPC which she used for her buy-and-sell fish business. She was able to open her store from the revenue generated and to also access financial services from GDMPC microfinance. 

She is thankful to GDMPC that it helped to improve her ability to engage in business. She borrowed a new loan of 10,000 to purchase goods like sugar, flour, milk and additional canned goods to sell. She hopes to see her children successful in the future.

loans.use: to purchase goods like sugar, flour, milk and additional canned goods to sell.

loans.name: La Foi De  Aculesamedi Group

texts.fr:
Delima est le coordinateur  de son groupe La Foi. Il n'est pas mariee. Il habite dans la region nord est d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de Léau portable est très limité.

Il dirige son commerce de vente de du charbon  pendants les 8 derniers années. Avant de ce commercé ce commerce Il était  enseignant. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à grandir son commerce.

Des autres membres de La Foi ont besoin d'un  emprunt pour le commerce tel que ventes produits cosmétiques,  boissons gazeuses, produit alimentaires,  charbon,  etc.  Il dit que son défit  principal est de devenir un plus grand commerçant

Il  dit son but principal c’est d’avoir une plus grande commerce qui lui facilitera  à  voyagé dans des autre pays tel que panama.
texts.en:
Delima is the coordinator of the Faith group. He is unmarried. He lives in the north-eastern region of Haiti where electricity is scarce and drinking water is very limited.

He has been running his business selling charcoal over the past 8 years. Before he began trading he was a teacher. He hopes that this loan will help him expand his business.

Other members of Faith need a loan for retail commerce such as the sales of cosmetics, soft drinks, food products, charcoal, etc. He says his main challenge is to become a bigger trader.

He says his main goal is to have a larger business that will facilitate his traveling to another country such as Panama.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Es Rayons De Bord-De-Mere Group

texts.fr:
Bertheleine est la coordonnatrice de son groupe Les Rayons de Borddemere. Elle es une commercante. Elle habite dans la région Bord-de-Mere d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. Bertheleine a dirigé son commerce de Produit Divers pendant 12 années.

Avant de commencer ce commerce Bertheleine était un couturiere. elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans le produit divers. Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business de Produit Alimentaire.

Des autres membres militant ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme charbon, vetement, chaussures, entre autre. Bertheleine dit que les défis principal c'est devenus une grande commerçante. Elle dit que son but principal et son rêve c'est possède un gros business avec son fond et par la grâce de Dieu.
texts.en:
Bertheleine is the coordinator of the Les Rayons de Borddemere group. She is a retail merchant. She lives in the Bord-de-Mere region of Haiti where electricity is scarce and water is very limited. Bertheleine has been running her business selling various products for the past 12 years.

Before starting this business Bertheleine was a seamstress. She wants to use this loan to invest in various products. She hopes that this loan will help her expand her food products business.

Other active group members need a loan for retail businesses such as charcoal, clothing, shoes among others. Bertheleine said that her main challenge is to become a great retail merchant. She says her main goal and dream is to own a large business with her own funds and by the grace of God.

loans.use: buy various items such as shoes, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: La Segesse De Bord-De-Mere Group

texts.fr:
Meniau est le coordinateur de son groupe SEGESSE DE BORD-DE-MERE. Il habite dans la région de SEGESSE DE BORD-DE-MERE, d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. Il a dirigé son commerce de Moto pendant 11 années. Avant de commencer ce commerce, il était un professeur.

Meniau voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans pièces de moto et acheter un autre moteur et le mettre à transporter. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Des autres membres militant ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces. 

Meniau dit que ses défis principal est deveniez une grande commerçant. Meniau dit que son but principal et son rêve est possède une gros business avec sa propre fond avec la mercy de Dieu.
texts.en:
Meniau is the coordinator of the Segesse de Bord-de-Mere group. He lives in the Segesse de Bord-de-Mere area of Haiti where electricity is scarce and water is very limited. He has been running his motorcycle business for the past 11 years. Before starting this business, he was a professor.

Meniau wants to use this loan to invest in motorcycle parts and buy another engine and use it for transportation. He hopes that this loan will help him expand his business. Other active group members also need a loan for similar ventures.

Meniau said his main challenge is to become a great merchant. He said his main goal and dream was to own a large business with his own funds with the mercy of God.

loans.use: buy another motorcycle engine and use it for transportation

loans.name: Lumiere Celeste De Grande Savanne Group

texts.fr:
Israel est le coordinateur de son groupe Lumiere de Celeste de Grande Savanne. Il habite dans la région de Grande Savanne, d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. Il a dirigé son commerce de chaussures  pendant 5 années. Israel est marié et a 3 enfants.

Israel voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l'achat de chaussures. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Des autres membres Lumière Celeste ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme charbon, produit divers, vetement. Israel dit que ses défis principal est deveniez une grande commerçant. Il dit que son but principal et son rêve est possède une gros business avec sa propre fond avec la mercy de Dieu.
texts.en:
Israel is the coordinator of the Lumiere de Celeste de Grande Savanne group. He lives in the Grande Savanne area of Haiti where electricity is scarce and water is very limited. He has been running his shoe business for 5 years. He is married and has three children.

Israel wants to use this loan to invest in purchasing shoes. He hopes that this loan will help him expand his business. Other Lumiere de Celeste members need a loan for such businesses as selling charcoal, various products, clothing. 


Israel says his main challenge is to become a great trader. He says his main goal and dream is to become the owner of a large business using his own funds, with the mercy of God.

loans.use: buy shoes

loans.name: Marlon Jose

texts.es:
El joven Marlon José tiene más de tres años de residir en el municipio de condega, un pueblo ubicado en el norte del país a unos 35 km al norte de la ciudad de Estelí. El vino a esta ciudad en busca de trabajo y aquí hizo una familia, él está felizmente casado y tiene una hija en edad infantil.

En la actualidad el joven Marlon José se desempeña como técnico en una empresa de televisión por cable, es el encargado de dar servicio de reparación y mantenimiento a la red de cables de tv, él trabaja desde hace unos tres años y lo hace a diario de 7 am a 5pm de lunes a sábado, manejando buena relaciones laborales con sus compañeros de trabajo.

Este señor se presentó a las oficinas de condega con el objetivo de solicitar un financiamiento para poder comprar insumos para cultivar un plantillo de chiltomas y de esta manera poder obtener una buena producción y por ende un ingreso aparte. Él se muestra positivo que se le aprobara este crédito y así podrá llevar a cabo su proyecto, ya que sus ingresos mensuales no son lo suficiente como para poder asumir los costos totales por cuenta propia.
texts.en:
Marlon José has lived in the town of Condega for more than three years. It is a town located in the northern part of the country, 35 km north of the city of Estelí. He came to this city seeking work and started a family here. He is happily married and has an infant daughter. 

Right now, Marlon José works as a technician in a cable television company. He is in charge of repair and maintenance service for the cable tv network. He has worked for around three years and does it every day from 7 am to 5 pm, Monday through Saturday, maintaining a good work relationship with his co-workers.

He came to the Condega offices with the purpose of asking for a loan to grow some chiltoma peppers, in order to have a good yield and therefore some extra income. He is positive that this loan will be approved and this way he can undertake his project. His monthly income isn't enough to assume the total costs on his own.

loans.use: to buy materials to plant vegetables.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rodrigo Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando es un hombre de 40 años, con los conocimientos adquiridos en la escuela primaria ha podido trabajar como comerciante en varias áreas, está casado con Elvia de 37 años quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y cuidado de sus 3 hijos que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela fiscal de la ciudad donde viven: Salcedo, ubicado en la parte Oriente de Cotopaxi una de las provincias más importantes de la Sierra ecuatoriana. 
Una ciudad ideal para actividades de comercio por el paso de turistas en la ciudad y las necesidades de sus habitantes. A pesar de estas actividades productivas que se desarrollan como la agricultura y ganadería, hay índices muy preocupantes de analfabetismo y de pobreza por necesidades básicas insatisfechas como por ejemplo el servicio de alcantarillado que solo lo tienen el 25% de los hogares pero en lo cual las autoridades locales se encuentran trabajando para resolver este tipo de necesidades en cada hogar.
Mientras tanto, sus habitantes buscan la manera de llevar el sustento a sus hogares a pesar de la falta de empleo, es el caso de Fernando quien desde hace 20 años estableció su propio taller de pintura y enderezada de vehículos, actividad que la desarrolló desde niño con la ayuda e instrucción de su hermano mayor y ahora la realiza independientemente dedicando entre 8 y 10 horas cada día para  entregar a sus clientes un acabado perfecto y puntual en los trabajos que le son encomendados. Hace 2 años Fernando sufrió un asalto en su negocio que le generó mucha pérdida por el material y herramientas que los delincuentes se llevaron, sin embargo pensando en su familia, Fernando no se dio por vencido y poco a poco se ha recuperado laboral, emocional y económicamente, por lo cual ahora requiere un préstamo que lo usará en la compra de pintura y materiales que le ayuden a mejorar su trabajo y además a obtener un ahorro por el descuento que sus proveedores le otorgan por compra al por mayor y pago de contado. Con este abastecimiento de material Fernando podrá recibir más pedidos de trabajos y entregar a tiempo para que así sus clientes lo recomienden y pueda generar mayores ingresos que le ayudarán a brindar a su familia un mejor estilo de vida. 
La falta de capital dejó de ser un problema desde que Fernando llegó a Fundación Alternativa en donde confiaron en él y en sus proyectos y a través del producto Kiva le pudieron dar la oportunidad de acceder a un crédito, por lo cual él anima a los inversionistas a continuar apoyando a los emprendedores principalmente de su país.
texts.en:
Fernando is 40 year old man. With the knowledge he acquired at primary school he has been able to work as a merchant in many areas. He is married to Elvia, who is 37 years old. She does the housework and cares for their 3 children who are in public school in the city where they live, Salcedo. It is located in the eastern part of Cotopaxi, one of the most important provinces in the Ecuadorian sierra. It is an ideal city for merchant activities because of the tourists that go through the city and its residents' needs. In addition to productive activities such as farming and cattle raising, there are worrying rates of illiteracy and poverty due to unsatisfied basic needs, for example a sewage system, which only 25% of the homes have, but which local authorities are working on to resolve. 

Meanwhile, its residents seek to support their homes despite a lack of employment, as is the case of Fernando. Twenty years ago he set up his own vehicle painting and bodywork workshop, an activity he developed as a child with the help and instruction of his older brother. Now he does it on his own, working between 8 and 10 hours a day to deliver to his customers a perfect finish on time. Two years ago, Fernando underwent an armed robbery at his business which caused a lot of loss due to the materials and tools that the assailants took. Nonetheless, thinking of his family, Fernando didn't give up and little by little he has recovered professionally, emotionally and financially. Now he needs a loan that he will use to buy paint and materials that will help him to improve his work and get some savings from the discount his suppliers will give him for buying in bulk and paying up front. By stocking these materials, Fernando can take on more work orders and deliver on time because his customers will recommend him and he can generate more income that will help him offer his family a better quality of life. 

The lack of capital stopped being a problem since Fernando came to Fundación Alternativa, where they trusted him and his projects. Through Kiva, they were able to give him an opportunity of accessing a loan. Because of this, he encourages the investors to keep supporting entrepreneurs, especially in his country.

loans.use: to invest in paint and materials for vehicle bodywork.

loans.name: Exemple De Bord-De-Mere Group

texts.fr:
Antoine est le coordinateur de son groupe Exemple de Borddemer. Il est un commercant. Il habite dans la région BOR-DE-MER où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. Antoine dirigé son commerce de produit divers pendant 9 années. 

Il voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans la acheter de produit divers. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Les acheter des chaussures, vêtements, cosmétiques, etc. Antoine dit que les défis principal c'est devenus une grande commerçante. Il dit que son but principal et son rêve c'est possède un gros business avec son fond et par la grâce de Dieu.
texts.en:
Antoine is the coordinator of the Exemple de Borddemer group. He is a merchant. He lives in the Borddemer region where electricity is scarce and water is very limited. Antoine ran his business selling various products for the past nine years.

He wants to use this loan to invest in purchasing various products. He hopes that this loan will help him expand his business by buying shoes, clothes, cosmetics, etc.

Antoine said that the main challenge is to become a great merchant. He says his main goal and dream is to own a large business using his own funds, by the grace of God.

loans.use: buy various products (clothing, cosmetics, shoes)

loans.name: José Reynaldo

texts.es:
José es originario de la perla del Septentrión Matagalpa ubicada geográficamente en el noroeste de Nicaragua una ciudad muy linda altamente productora de café, estado civil de José es acompañado el núcleo familiar está compuesto por su cónyuge, tres hijos y su mamá , este varón se caracteriza por ser una persona trabajadora y comprometido con su familia.

Con los créditos obtenidos anteriormente manifiesta que han sido de gran importancia ya que ha resuelto algunos problemas en su familia.
José se desempeña como fontanero de una empresa de servicio de acueducto y alcantarillado su función es brindarle mantenimiento a todas las tuberías potables e instalar servicio nuevo.

Con el monto financiado lo va destinar para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como ladrillo, arena, cemento y pago de mano de obra por el mejoramiento de su vivienda.

Manifiesta su entusiasmo y agradecimiento a kiva por este tipo de apoyo ya que es una manera que las familias pobre puedan mejora sus viviendas.
texts.en:
José is from Perla del Septentrión Matagalpa, located in north eastern Nicaragua, It is a very pretty city which produces a lot of coffee. Jose is married anis nuclear family is made up of his spouse, his three children and their mother. This man is characterized as being a hardworking person who is committed to his family.

He says that the loans he took out before were very important, since they have resolved some family problems. José works as a plumber in a water company. His job is to maintain the potable water pipes and install new accesses. 

With the loan he is going to buy construction materials such as brick, sand, and cement, as well as pay for labor costs, in order to do some home improvement.

He shows his enthusiasm and thanks for Kiva, for this support, since it is a way that poor families can improve their homes.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as: cement, sand, gravel, artisanal bricks and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Damiran

texts.en:
Damiran is 37 years old. He lives with his wife and a son in a Ger, which is a traditional nomadic tent, in Uvs Province in Mongolia. His wife, Nemeh, works at a local kindergarten as a teacher, and his son Iderjavhlan is age 5 and enrolling in primary school in Uvs this fall. 

Damiran has been in his transportation service business since 1999 with his Russian truck. Recently his truck broke down and needs to be fixed in order to continue providing transportation services. He is now requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to purchase spare parts and to cover the repair cost, enabling him to run his transportation business. He is a hardworking, well-behaved, and responsible man.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and to cover repair costs, enabling him to run his transportation business.

loans.name: Felicita Del Socorro

texts.es:
Felicita del Socorro de cincuenta y un años de edad. Madre soltera con cuatro hijos. Ella es originaria de León, lugar  que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país.  Ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfruta de su familia, lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria y se vio obligad a trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.

Gracia a sus esfuerzo y sus ganas de Salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles, y en cantidades  pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergente, aceite, jugos, gaseosas, fósforos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos.  El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Felicita agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua  para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Felicita del Socorro is 51 years old. She is a single mother with four children. She is from León, which is located on the western side of the country. She is characterized as being a hard-working, responsible woman who strives for personal improvement. In her free time she enjoys spending time with her family. Unfortunately, she was never able to complete a university degree as she felt obligated to work from an early age to help with household expenses.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, she has been able to maintain, as her main economic activity, a small grocery store where she sells small quantities of food products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, and eggs, and also sells detergent, oil, juice, soft drinks, and matches. She works in her shop for 12 hours a day. She would like to use the loan to invest in working capital to supply her business in the buying and selling of food products so that in the near future she will be able to obtain higher profits. Felicita is thankful for the help that the Kiva lenders give to people with scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua to have a decent working environment.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and supply her business in the buying and sales of food products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, and eggs, detergent, oil, juice, soft drinks, and matches.

loans.name: Sinoun

texts.en:
Residing in the Kandal Stoeng District of Kandal Province, Sinoun is 46 years old and married. She has four children, three of whom are dependents and still in school. She and her husband have struggled to feed their children by farming rice. She and her husband have been in this business for 18 years.

Sinoun has been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, for three loans. She has successfully used the past three loans to better support her current business and also to improve her living condition. Now, she is applying as a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund to pay her son's university fees. She hopes that the loan will enable her to keep her son in university to pursue his degree, helping him to find a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay her son's university fees.

loans.name: Ruben De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Rubén de Jesús habita en la ciudad de Somoto en el departamento de Madriz en el norte de Nicaragua, él es empleado en una empresa estatal, está felizmente casado y su esposa atiende una pulpería que tiene en su casa de habitación, tiene tres hijos menores de edad. Este señor reside junto a su familia en su casa propia desde hace unos 20 años siendo muy conocido por el vecindario como una persona trabajadora y honrada.
El señor Rubén de Jesús se desempeña como conductor en la empresa estatal de acueductos y  alcantarillados desde hace unos cinco años y medio de manera estable manejando buenas relaciones laborales con sus compañeros de trabajo.
Este cliente se presentó a las oficinas de ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un financiamiento para realizarle mejoras a su casa de habitación, este es el segundo ciclo crediticio en los dos últimos años.
El necesita comprar varias láminas de zinc para poder cambiar parte del techo y componer unos canales de desagüe y el pago de mano de obra del constructor. El espera de manera positiva le sea aprobado el crédito ya que le urge mejorar su vivienda y sus ingresos no le permiten asumir el solo el gasto, espera mejorar sus condiciones de  vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Rubén de Jesús lives in the city of Somoto in the department of Madriz in northern Nicaragua. He is employed by a state-run company. He is happily married and his wife runs a small grocery store out of their home. He has three young children. He has lived together with his family in his own house for the past 20 years and he is well-known in the neighborhood as being a hard-working and honest person. He has worked steadily as a driver for a state-run water supply and sewage company for the past five and a half years and has maintained good working relationships with his coworkers. 

This client has come to the Ceprodel office to apply for financial assistance to be able to make repairs on his house. This would be his second credit cycle in the past two years. He needs to buy several zinc metal sheets to change part of the roof and to buy gutters gutters, and money to pay a construction worker to carry out the task. He hopes to be approved for a loan since it is urgent that he make repairs on his home and his earnings do not allow him to take on the repair costs alone. He hopes to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy zinc metal sheeting and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She is using her loans in her business as additional capital. Aside from her variety store, she also sells rice per kilo for additional income. Her income from business helped in her everyday expenses. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial growth with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Angelina hopes to make her business big and dreams of visiting Israel. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Bernadeth works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from selling vegetables and raising pigs. Bernadeth is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell in her dried fish business.

Bernadeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk (pastries, soft drinks, fruit, candy, potatoes and vegetables to make empanadas and pies) and to improve the workspace by purchasing a display case and ordering advertisement flyers.

loans.name: Ganpurev

texts.en:
Ganpurev is 45 years old. He lives with his wife and four children in a Ger, which is a traditional nomadic tent, in Uvs Province in Mongolia. His wife, Otgonbayar, sells their organic vegetables at a rental counter in a local market. His three sons and daughter attend university, local secondary school, and primary school, and they also help their parents in the fields during their summer vacation.
 
Ganpurev has been growing organic vegetables on their plot of land for years and has lots of experience in the business. He increased the variety of vegetables to provide customers with high quality organic vegetables. He is now requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to harvest their organic vegetables and to pay for his son's education. He is a hardworking, diligent, and well-experienced man.

loans.use: to harvest their organic vegetables and to pay for his son's education.

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en:
Eddie is very thankful for the financial help he receives. He is using this loan as additional capital for his business. His profit is helping him with his education, and he is able to help his family as well. He dreams of being an Information Technologist. 

He would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan. He will use the loan to buy additional computers, video cards and sound cards for his computer shop. The profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his education and his family's daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Eddie dreams of having a big computer shop. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group consists of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for an additional computers, video cards and sound cards for his computer shop.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 54 years old and married with three children.

Marlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Marlyn has borrowed and paid off 13 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running her business for 7 years and also earns income from farming and selling vegetables.

Marlyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has charcoal business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Rosita has been in this business for 5 years. She earns more income from vulcanizing shop.

Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell,

loans.name: Chamroen

texts.en:
Chamroen is a citizen from a rural area in Kandal Province’s Ponhea Leur District. He is 22 years old and single. To make a living, he has been working for a company in his village for one year. The current job earns him about 35,000 KHR per day, but he can save about 20,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.

Chamroen, who has never been with VisionFund before, is now seeking his first loan. He is going to use this loan to pay his tuition fees for the four years of his bachelor degree program in Information Technology. This loan will enable him to have a good and bright future because his academic studies will allow him to earn a better living in the future.

loans.use: To pay his tuition fees.

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
Sophal, 38, is married with three children, and she resides in a rural village in the Sangke district of Battambang province. All of her children are dependents and still in school. To support the  family, she has been growing cassava and catching fish while her husband is a teacher. 

Sophal’s group consists of two female members who just started with VisionFund for this cycle. She and her group member are applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. She will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes to make more rice to increase her family’s income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland.

loans.name: Erjan

texts.en:
Erjan is 41 years old and lives with his wife and children in a Ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. His wife Farida is 27 years old and stays home taking care of their family. 

His older son Erketai has just started running a taxi service business with a recently purchased second hand car. Two of Erjan's children study in Kazakhstan because it is a little less costly than studying in Ulaanbaatar, the capital, and they work part-time to pay for tuition fees and living expenses. His two younger children live at home and attend a local school and kindergarten.

Erjan has been producing Kazakh Ger frames and selling them to local customers for years and barely covers the family's expenses. He is planning to build a house to provide his family with decent living conditions. He is now requesting loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase building, insulation and other materials to build his house before the harsh Mongolian winter comes. He is a positive, hardworking and kind man.

loans.use: to purchase building, insulation and other materials to build his house before the harsh Mongolian winter arrives

loans.name: Jandyr Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar tiene 20 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica y con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado iniciar su negocio de venta de abarrotes en un pequeño espacio de la vivienda donde habita. Edgar trabaja con mucho empeño ya que con los ingresos de su pequeño negocio apoya a su padres con los gastos del hogar.

Edgar está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar vitrinas para su negocio, lo que le permitirá colocar sus productos de mejor manera, también podrá comprar un televisor, para su domicilio, asi el podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y seguir apoyando a su familia”.
texts.en:
Edgar, 20, lives in the city of Ica, and through much effort he has started a small grocery store in his home.  He works very hard because with the income from his small business he helps his parents with the household expenses.

Edgar is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he can buy display cases for his store.  This will allow him to arrange and display his products the best way possible.  He also will be able to buy a television set for home which will improve his quality of life so he can continue the struggle toward his greatest dream:  "To have his own house and continue supporting his family".

loans.use: To buy display cases and a television set.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Carlos Enrique es una habitante de la ciudad de Somoto en el departamento de Madriz al norte de Nicaragua, este señor esta felizmente casado y vive junto a su esposa en su propia casa de habitación y reside en ella desde hace unos 21 años, siendo muy conocido por los vecinos como una persona de buenas costumbres y trabajadora.
Este señor es empleado y labora para la empresa nicaragüense de acueductos desempeñándose como responsable de bodega, él es el encargado de todos los materiales de trabajo que se utilizan en esta empresa. Este cliente tiene más de 24 años de labora en esta empresa, él trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 7 ama las 5 pm, manejando buenas relaciones laborales con los compañeros de trabajo.
Este cliente se presentó a las oficinas de ceprodel con el objetivo de solicitar su segundo financiamiento para mejorar su casa de habitación, el necesita comprar madera y zinc para poder reconstruir parte de techo de su casa, el cliente se muestra positivo en que le será aprobado el nuevo financiamiento y así poder darle una vivienda más digna a su familia, ya que sus ingresos no son los suficiente como para poder costear los gastos por cuenta propia
texts.en:
Carlos Enrique lives in the city of Somoto in the department of Madriz, in northern Nicaragua.  He is happily married and lives with his wife in his own home, where he has resided for 21 years.  He is well known by his neighbors who believe he is a hard-working, mild-mannered person.

He works for the Nicaraguan water company as head of the warehouse.  He is in charge of all the work materials used by the company.  Carlos Enrique has been working for the company for over 24 years  He works Monday through Friday from 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., and has a good relationship with his co-workers.

The borrower has requested his second loan through Ceprodel in order to renovate his home.  He needs to buy wood and metal sheeting to rebuild part of the roof.  He is confident the loan will be approved and he will be able to give his family better living conditions.  His income is not enough to cover the costs without support.

loans.use: To buy construction materials such as wood and metal sheeting.

loans.name: Alma Isabel

texts.es:
Alma es originaria de la bella ciudad de Estelí ubicada en el norte de Nicaragua, su estado civil es soltero y tiene dos hijos uno en  edad escolar.

Profesión es Licenciada de la educación actualmente se desempeña como docente de secundaria desde hace más de 33 años, manifiesta sentirse motivada en ejercer su profesión ya que ha creado cariños a sus estudiantes que está formando día a día.

Este es su cuarto crédito con CEPRODEL el cual los anteriores han sido de gran impacto ya que ha mejorado su vivienda y pagado gasto universitario de su hijo.

solicita un crédito para la compra materiales de construcción: 20 perlines, 30 lámina de zinc, 2 galones de pintura anticorrosiva y 300 golosos ya que está realizando mejora en el techo de su vivienda que actualmente está en mal estado.

Alma agradece el apoyo brindado por kiva ya que de esta manera podrá realizar las mejoras de su vivienda y brindar una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Alma is a native of the beautiful city of Estelí, located in the northern part of Nicaragua.  She is single and has two children, one of which is school age.

She is licensed to teach.  Presently, she works as a high school teacher, and has been doing this for thirty-three years.  She says that she feels motivated in carrying out her work, and that she cares more and more for her students every day.

This is her fourth loan with Ceprodel.  The previous loans have had a great impact, and she has already improved her home and paid university expenses for her son.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy construction materials: 20 horizontal roof beams, 30 sheets of tin roofing, 2 gallons of noncorrosive paint, and 300 screws.  She is improving the roof of her home; it is currently in poor condition.

Alma is grateful for the support that Kiva has offered her.  In this manner, she will be able to make the improvements to her home and offer a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials: 20 horizontal roof beams, 30 sheets of tin roofing, 2 gallons of noncorrosive paint, and 300 screws.

loans.name: Kelly Nayda

texts.es:
Kelly es una joven de 19 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Kelly se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Contabilidad.
Por iniciativa propia, Kelly trabaja como secretaria en una mecánica de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Kelly se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará una moto lineal, la cual le servirá de mucho para poder transportarse desde las lejanías de su hogar hasta su centro de trabajo y estudios, de esta manera Kelly ahorrara un poco de dinero en movilidad y lo utilizara en sus estudios, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Kelly, 19, is single and lives in the city of Cañete in the district of Imperial with her parents and siblings.  She is a very kind, hard-working, enthusiastic person who has a great desire to improve her situation.  Thanks to the efforts and support of her parents, Kelly is studying for an accounting degree.

On her own initiative, Kelly works as a secretary at a mechanics workshop in her city.  She works every day approximately eight hours and believes things are going well for her because of her dedication and kindness to others.

Kelly is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will buy a motorcycle which will help her travel the far distance from her home to her work and educational center.  Kelly will be able to save money this way which she will put toward her studies.  She will be able to continue working and struggling toward her goal of becoming a good professional.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 34 años, está casada con Aquiles y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Luz se dedica a la agricultura, por ello está laboriosa mujer se dedica a la siembra de papa, alverja y maíz; asimismo cría animales como vacas, toros, de los cuales saca una buena cantidad de leche para la elaboración de queso, los que vende en una ciudad cercana, obteniendo buenas ganancias. Ya tiene más de 20 años dedicándose a la agricultura y ganadería. Y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poner en práctica lo que sus padres le enseñaron. Además cuenta que es muy buena en la venta ya que después de cada cosecha los comercializa en el mercado mayorista de su localidad. Paralelo a su trabajo, ella se dedica a cocinar los alimentos del día a los trabajadores de un terreno cercano. Ahora después de cosechar sus cultivos de papa, piensa sembrar alverja y papa de otra variedad; sin descuidar a sus animales. Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Luz, invertirá los S/.3000 en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Luz is thirty-four years old.  She is married to Aquiles and has two children.  They all live together in their own house.  

Luz makes a living in agriculture, and is a hardworking woman dedicated to cultivating potatoes, peas, and corn.  She also raises animals, like cows and bulls.  She is able to get a good quantity of milk from them in order to make cheese, which she sells in a nearby city.  She makes good profits.  She has been working in agriculture and livestock for more than twenty years.  The thing she likes most about her work is the fact that she puts what her parents taught her into practice.  She also says that she is good at sales, and that after each harvest, she sells her products at the wholesale market in her town.  In addition to her work, she also dedicates herself to cooking daytime meals for the laborers who work the nearby land.  After harvesting the potatoes, she thinks she will plant peas and another variety of potatoes.  She will do this without neglecting her animals.  

This is her fourth loan with Kiva, and she is grateful for the financial support she receives in order to continue moving forward.  She furthermore promises to pay her installments in a punctual manner.  

Luz will invest her 3,000 soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer that will nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Jambaldorj

texts.en:
Mr. Jambaldorj is 56 years old lives with his wife and a son in a ger, a traditional nomadic tent, in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife Serjmaa is retired, stays home taking care of her husband and son and runs a small food booth on their plot of land. His son Otgonhuu is 23, has graduated and is currently looking for job while helping his parents. 

Jambaldorj has been working at a local shoe manufacturing company since 2005. He is starting to produce leather shoes to sell to local customers on his own. He has years of experience, and is now requesting 5,000,000 MNT to purchase a starting inventory to start a shoe manufacturing business. 

He is a hardworking, modest and responsible man.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory for a shoe manufacturing business

loans.name: Ivania Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Ivania es originaria de la ciudad de León, Soltera y madre de 3 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace 7 años. Esta agradecida con Kiva y MiCredito ya que logro aumentar su inventario, adquirir mayores ingresos y satisfacer a sus clientes. Hoy en día solicita el crédito para comprar: sandalias, zapatos, chinelas de baño, deportivos, entre otros, con el fin de seguir invirtiendo y hacer crecer su negocio, realiza sus ventas en su casa, ya que es una zona donde tiene mucha clientela.
texts.en:
Ivania is from the city of León.  She is single and has three children.  She works as a merchant selling used clothing and has been in business for seven years.  She is grateful to Kiva and MiCredito because she was able to increase her inventory, earn more income and satisfy her customers.

Now she is requesting a loan to buy sandals, shoes, beachwear, sportswear and other items in an effort to continue investing in and growing her business.  She works from home because she has many customers in the area.

loans.use: To buy sandals, shoes, beachwear, sportswear, etc.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
This is Ofelia. She previously accessed an 14,000 PHP loan that she used buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread, and other items needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. She is now into a buy and sell business and she has stopped her tailoring business for a while.

She would like to apply for another 16,000 PHP loan to buy more different products like slippers, undergarments, umbrellas, and blankets needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ofelia hopes that her business will continue to flourish, and dreams that her child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for different products like slippers, undergarments, umbrellas, and blankets needed in her business.

loans.name: Ana Yesenia

texts.es:
Ana de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta 9º grado, está acompañada, su compañero de vida es motorista, tiene 3 hijos de 17,12 y 5 años todos estudian.

Lleva 3 años de ser comerciante de ropa, pero hace un año y medio decidió vender panes. Lo aprendió por iniciativa propia, ya que es buena en la cocina, el negocio lo ha instalado en su casa junto con una pequeña tienda y lo hace ella sola.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar bebidas, golosinas y otros productos como pan dulce, etc.,  con esto podrá tener más venta y no dejar ir a los clientes. 
  
Pretende mantener un negocio reconocido y así remodelar con las ganancias su vivienda, contribuir con los gastos de la casa, permitirles a sus hijos gozar de una educación adecuada, en su negocio, quiere instalar  un cafetín en el futuro.
texts.en:
Ana, 32, has a ninth grade education.  She and her common-law husband have three children, ages 17, 12 and five, who are all in school.

She has been selling clothing for three years, but one year ago decided to sell breads.  She learned the trade on her own initiative because she is a good cook.  Her business is set up at home where she has a small store and works alone.

The loan she is requesting is to buy drinks, sweets and other products such as sweet bread, etc  This will increase her sales and help keep her customers.

She wants to have a well-known business and use her profits to renovate her home, contribute to household expenses and give her children a good education.  In the future, she would like to set up a coffee shop at home.

loans.use: To buy drinks, sweets and other products such as sweet bread, etc. to increase sales.

loans.name: Sarun's Group

texts.en:
Sarun, 31, is married with two children and resides in a rural village located in the Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Cambodia. For the last 13 years, she has been farming rice and planting cassava. To supplement the income, she can earn about 24,000KHR per day to meet the family’s need.

Sarun’s group consists of three members who live in the same village, and she has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles already. The past loans from VisionFund have helped her better support her family. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Sarun, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Arcelita

texts.en:
Arcelita is 31 years old and married with three children.

Arcelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buying and selling of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Arcelita has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for 10 years and also earns an income from a general store.

Arcelita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Sopheak's Group

texts.en:
Sopheak is aged 28 years and married. She lives in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, earning a living through planting cassava in the village. Engaged in this business for three years, she is able to earn about 54,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day to meet the family’s needs.

Sopheak is in her fourth loan cycle as a client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sopheak is going to use her portion to pay for labor fees in plowing the field. She hopes to grow more cassava and sell it for a good price, so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To pay for labor fees in plowing the field.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Saroen's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Saroen is 63 years old and married. She earns a living through raising pigs and distilling alcohol. Having been in this business for 10 years, she is able to earn about 49,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
This is the third loan for Saroen with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Saroen is going to use her portion to buy pig feeds for nourishing her pigs. She hopes to fatten her pigs, so as to sell them for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy pig feeds for nourishing her pigs.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Rosiel

texts.en:
This is Rosiel. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used buy more frozen and processed foods. Her earnings were a big help for her children's education and in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a new 20,000 PHP loan to purchase more stock of frozen and processed foods like hot dogs, ham and sausages. She will also use the loan in buying charcoal, rice and fish. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosiel hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more stock of frozen and processed foods like hot dogs, ham, sausages and more.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Luzviminda works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and furniture making. Luzviminda is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food-vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her businesses.

Luzviminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her businesses to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
