Jefferson de 21 años trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de artículos para fiestas, como piñatas, globos, disfraces, entre otros; Jefferson labora alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede llegar a atender hasta 10  clientes al día; Jefferson cree que está saliendo adelante con su negocio porque es amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque ofrece productos novedosos.

Jefferson está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar globos al por mayor, piñatas, disfraces, pelucas, entre otros, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y tener un negocio mucho más grande”.
texts.en:
Jefferson, who is 21 years old, works in his small business selling party supplies, like piñatas, balloons and costumes, among others.  Jefferson works around 10 hours a day and can serve up to 10 customers a day.  

Jefferson believes that he is getting ahead in his business because he is friendly with his customers and above all, because he offers novel products.

Jefferson is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they have provided, he will be able to buy wholesale balloons, piñatas, costumes, wigs, and other items, which will allow him to continue striving to make his greatest dream a reality:  "To have his own house and to have a much bigger business."

loans.use: to buy party supplies.

loans.name: Rital Del Pilar

texts.es:
Rita es una mujer con mucho carisma y entusiasmo, tiene 40 años y con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado tener su negocio de salón de belleza, en el cual trabaja con mucho cariño y dedicación, Rita labora alrededor de 10 horas y puede atender hasta 15 clientes al día, Rita cree que le está yendo bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes.

Rita está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar equipo para su peluquería como secadoras, planchas de cabello, cepillos especiales, entre otros, de esta manera podra tener los materiales necesarios para poder atender a sus clientes y de esta manera seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño de : Tener un gran spa”.
texts.en:
Rita is a woman with a lot of charisma and enthusiasm.  She is 40 years old and through great effort, she has succeeded in having her own beauty salon, in which she works with a lot of care and dedication.  

Rita works around 10 hours and can attend to up to 15 customers a day.  Rita believes that things are going well in her business because she is very friendly with her customers.  

Rita is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they have given her, she will be able to buy equipment for her salon like hairdryers, hair irons, special brushes, and other things.  In this way, she will be able to have the necessary materials to tend to her customers and to continue striving to make her great dream a reality:  To have a big spa.

loans.use: to buy hairdressing tools.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha was born in 1993. She lives in Dong Anh District. She is a rural development major at Hanoi University of Agriculture . Her course lasts four years and she will graduate in 2015. Her family has five members. She is the first person in her family to attend college. Her father is a carpenter and her mother is a farmer. Her family’s income is about 6,000,000 VND per month. Her education fees are subsidized by her parents. 

Ha plans to find a part-time job to earn more money to pay for her education’s fee. She understands that her education will provide her with the opportunity to get a high paying job. She is aware that this major is suitable for herself and she wants to have more knowledge to help farmers in breeding and growing. After graduating, she can earn money to assist her family, improve her family’s living standard, and contribute her part to build a richer and more beautiful homeland. 

Ha is requesting a loan for 10,206,000 VND, which she will use to pay for her education fees. If she could not access this loan, her studying would be interrupted.

loans.use: to pay for her education fees.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha de 38 años, tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia a base de material rústico desde hace 15 años. Bertha es una mujer alegre y a la vez esmerada en sus labores. Hace casi 20 años que siembra papa, arveja, y maíz. “Los productos de mi localidad son buenos porque crecen sanos y fuertes”, comenta Bertha. Pero no sólo se dedica a ello, también tiene animales; vacas, cerdos y burros, estos últimos que le ayudan a trasportar el abono o también los productos que cosecha. Ahora piensa cultivar una parcela más de arvejas, pues su meta futura es mejorar su producción y venderla en otras ciudades. Sus metas del año son claras, por ello requiere sembrar más arvejas y maíz. Solicita de su apoyo para esto. Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA, y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Bertha, invertirá los S/.2500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Bertha is 38-years old and has two children who live with her in her own home.  Her home of the last fifteen years is built of rustic materials.  Bertha is a happy woman but also conscientious in her work.  For twenty years has planted potatoes, peas and corn.  “The produce from my area is good because the plants grow strong and healthy”, says Bertha.  But she doesn't solely make her living from farming; she also has animals: cows, pigs and donkeys.  The donkeys help with transporting compost and also her harvest.  Bertha is thinking about cultivating another parcel of peas, as her future goal is to improve production and sell her produce in other cities.  Her goals for the year are clear, which is why she needs to plant more peas and corn.  This is what Bertha is requesting the loan for.  This is her fourth loan with KIVA, and she feels grateful for the financial help she is receiving to keep moving forward.  In addition, Bertha promises to make her payments punctually.  Bertha will invest the S/.2500 soles (USD $900) in the purchase of organic compost to nourish her sown fields.

loans.use: to purchase organic compost.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 47 años es una mujer soltera. Vive en compañía de sus padres en su casa propia. Cuidar a su familia siempre fue su prioridad, no se arrepiente de ello pues gracias a su buen juicio puede disfrutar de una vida tranquila. Comenta que su principal ingreso económico proviene de la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de comestibles que abrió hace 22 años, “gracias a este negocio, pude enfrentar muchos retos económicos”, afirma. Es así que ella es muy conocida en la zona, los pobladores desde muy temprano compran los alimentos del día, ella desea mejorar los productos que vende comprando nuevos alimentos, además de carne y verduras que no se encuentran en el pueblo, espera poder lograr sus objetivos.Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, por lo espera continuar con su apoyo financiero, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Luz, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de productos comestibles como arroz, leche, azúcar, entre otros.
texts.en:
47-year old Luz is a single mother living with her parents in their own home. To care for her family has always been her priority and she has never regretted this. Thanks to her good judgment she has enjoyed a tranquil life. Luz's principal source of income comes from her grocery store which she started 22 years ago. She says, "It is thanks to this business that I have been able to overcome many financial challenges."

Luz is well known in the area. From early in the morning people buy their groceries from her. Now she wishes to offer different products such as meat and vegetables that are not found in the town and in this way reach her goals. 

This is Luz's first loan with Kiva and she hopes to continue receiving financing. She promises to pay back the money punctually. She plans to buy items such as rice, milk, and sugar with the S/.500 loan.

loans.use: Buy groceries such as rice, milk, and sugar

loans.name: Tres Barrios De Ccoricancha Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “TRES BARRIOS DE CCORICANCHA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Chinchero y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Isabel ella es casada y tiene 36 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes,la socia lleva años con su negocio el cual le va bien graciasd al empeño que le pone cada dia asu negocio,la socia cria a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia desea poider segrui trabajando para de esta forma segrui apoyando a su fmailia.

La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes para su negocio.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de verduras, ganadería, tienda de abarrotes,agricultura y
crianza de animales.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to Tres Barrios de Ccoricancha Communal Bank, located in the district of Chinchero in the province of Chinchero and department of Cusco.

The member, Isabel, 36, is married and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business raising small animals such as guinea pigs.  She has had the business for years and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  Isabel raises these little animals to sell to her customers who request them.  She wants to continue working so she can support her family.

Isabel's requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs for her business.

The other members sell vegetables, have a grocery store, raise animals, and work in ranching and agriculture.
 
Isabel's grateful to those who are part of her dream through this loan.  She promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 28-year-old gentleman, married to Teresa. He is the father of two children, ages four and two years. He operates a food stall in the Lower side of Narok town, in a densely-populated, informal settllement area. He learned about KADET from some of his regular customers. 

He has been issued a third loan, in the amount of KES 60,000, after having successfully repaid the previous ones. He will use the funds to purchase a tent, so as to cover the outer space of his stall, especially in this cold season. This will allow him to accomondate more customers at the same time, thus earning more income.

Samuel will plough back the profits into the business, for further expansion. His dreams are to build rental houses, and to educate his children to high levels of education.

loans.use: to purchase a tent to enlarge his food stall

loans.name: Nastorio

texts.en:
Nastoroi is 31 years old. He is an old client of UGAFODE Microfinance who has borrowed six times from UGAFODE. He is a married man with three children aged eight, seven and one and a half. The first two go to school.

Nastoroi is a tea farmer who started tea farming in 2003. Farming is his sole source of income, and he gives it an average of six hours per day. The farm is located in rural Ishaka, Bushenyi. He started the business with the purpose of getting a clear source of income so he could educate his children. 

Nastoroi would like to use the loan money to buy fertilizers to put in his tea garden so that it will yield more and hence produce more income, enough money to educate his children. His major clients are the tea traders in his local area. His major challenges include seasons, which change unexpectedly and affect the quantities he harvests. However, he has hopes that the loan he gets (3,000,000 UGX) will boost his business and help him achieve his goal in life.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Dariko

texts.en:
Dariko is 54 years old. She is widowed and lives alone in the Lagodekhi district. The only source of income for her is a little social assistance (nearly 36 USD) from the local government, as she lives below the poverty line. Dariko requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected all the time because of her low income and her poor living conditions. 

Dariko requested a loan from Credo to start an agricultural business. Her loan request was approved within the frames of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Dariko will purchase two calves. After purchasing livestock, she will raise them and sell them in the spring for a higher price. It will generate an income and the new business initiative financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May was born in 1992. She lives in Đong Anh District. Her major is Finance and Banking, at Dai Nam University (http://www.dnu.edu.vn/). Her course lasts 48 months, and she will graduate in 2014. May’s family has six members. She is the first person in her family who has a higher education. Her parents breed chickens and pigs, and grow rice, to earn a living. Her family’s income is about 4,000,000 VND per month.

May has a passion for her major, because this field of study is consistent with her abilities and she can find a good job with it. She wants to continue until she finishes this university degree. She wants to borrow 14,580,000 VND to pay her tuition. If she couldn’t access this loan, her studying would have to be interrupted.

After graduating, she hopes to find a highly-paid job, in order to support her family and contribute to the development of social good. Through this program, she wants to tell people that anyone who wants to, has the right to go to school; so please help poor people so they can go to school. She appreciates the help of people all around the world who have contributed to this kind of program. This has been supportive a lot, for her education individually, and the education of the Vietnamese youth generation, in general.

loans.use: to pay her tuition for university study in Finance and Banking

loans.name: Jose Guadalupe

texts.es: Don  José de 32 años de edad vive con su esposa y tres hijos en casa de un familiar se dedica a la agricultura espacialmente a la siembra de hortalizas desde hace varios años,  es un  hombre trabajador,  responsable  con su trabajo y su familia, comercializa sus cosechas en los alrededores de donde el reside,  José esta solicitando  un crédito  para mejorar  las ramadas  de sus hortalizas  y comprar herbicidas, controles de plagas, fertilizantes, etc.  para que de esta manera  genere  ingresos  mayores para su hogar  y así poder ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is 32 years old and lives with his wife and 3 children in the house of a family member. He farms for a living and for the last several years, has mainly grown vegetables. Jose is a hard-working man, responsible about his work and family. He sells his harvests in the areas around where he lives. 

Jose is soliciting a loan to improve the supports for his vegetables and to purchase herbicides, plague controls, fertilizers, etc.  In this manner, he hopes to generate greater income for his home and, thus, be able to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: improve the supports of his vegetable crops and buy herbicides, plague controls, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin is 42 years old and married, to Roseline. They have three children, who are in school.

He has a posho mill business in Naivasha, which he has operated for five years. He has applied for his fourth loan from KADET, after having repaid his previous loans on time. The new loan will enable him buy another posho mill. He plans to pay school fees with the anticipated profit. Kevin hopes to be financially stable in the near future.

loans.use: to buy another posho mill.

loans.name: Laidou Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les quatre femmes du groupe LAIDOU ont  en moyenne 43 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes SIENSO dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de leurs activités professionnelles et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de restauration, d’habits et de céréales. 
Dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles de plus en plus nombreuses et exigeantes, les membres du groupe ont décidé  d’intégrer  le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 5eme  prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents.
Madame MAH  (assise au milieu sur la photo) excelle dans la vente de céréales. Elle est très sollicitée à SIENSO et ses environnants. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  3 sacs de maïs, 2 sacs de petit mil, 1 sac de haricot .Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail  à une clientèle mixtes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame MAH  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 18000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et  aider son conjoint dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The [five?] members of the Laidou group are married women living in traditional expanded families. On the average, they are 43 years of age, with four children. They all live in Sienso, in the Ségou region (the fourth administrative region of Mali) and know each other as neighbors and relatives as well as through their work. They cook food for sale and also retail clothing and cereals. 

With the goal of meeting the needs of their growing and increasingly demanding customer bae, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and are now on their fifth solidarity loan, having duly repaid their prior loans.
Mrs. Mah (the one seated in the middle on the photo) excels at selling cereals. She has many customers in Sienso in nearby. She plans to use her loan to buy three bags of corn, two bags of pearl millet, and one bag of beans. She retails for cash to the general public. With this loan, Mrs. Mah hopes to achieve a monthly revenue of 18,000 West African francs, which will be used to reinvest in her business and to help her husband provide for household needs.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 22 years old and from Nakuru. He is married to Sylvia, who is a housewife, and they don't have any children yet.

Fredrick is in the business of repairing bicycles, which he has been doing for the past five years. He has applied for his first loan from Kadet Ltd, which he intends to use to buy more spare parts for his business.

He plans to use the anticipated profit to repay his loan to Kadet Ltd. His hope and dream for the future is to build a big garage.

loans.use: To purchase bicycle spare parts

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Emmy is a repeat client at UGAFODE. He operates a carpentry workshop, where he makes chairs, tables, and desks, among other items demanded by his clients. He is a father of six and of them, five attend school. He supplements the income from carpentry with tea growing, which is his major source of income.

He started the carpentry business in 1993, and through his hard work the business has grown and sustained the family. He started the business with a hope of getting enough money from the business to educate his children and meet their basic needs. Emmy says the dry season is his major challenge in his business, but he hopes that with time it will cease to be a challenge. He hopes to use the loan funds from UGAFODE (UGX 2,000,000) to buy a piece of land, on which he will construct a family house in the near future.

loans.use: to buy land, where he will build a family home

loans.name: Elva Bertha

texts.es:
Elva es una mujer de 46 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con sus hijos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, Elva trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, adicionalmente brinda servicios de corte de cabello, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que leva bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Elva se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará triplays y madera para acondicionar una pequeña peluquería en su vivienda, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
46-year old Elva lives with her children in the town of Cañete in Imperial district. She is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic woman who puts all her effort into helping her family get ahead.

On her own initiative Elva got a job as a worker on a local farm. She also cuts hair. Elva works for approximately ten hours a day and believes all is going well because of her dedication and effort.

She is very grateful to Kiva donors as it is thanks to their help that she will be able to buy plywood and wood to renovate the small salon located in her house. She will be able to carry on working and making the necessary effort to see her dream of having children with good jobs come true.

loans.use: Buy plywood

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel lives in Kongowea area, near Mombasa, Kenya. He is married and has two children, one of whom attends school. Daniel is a businessman, and he runs a small shop that sells plastic items. He has had a previous Kiva loan, which he repaid without challenges. Now he seeks another loan to buy water cans, basins, sets of dining plates, cups and cooking items. Daniel has an ambition of owning a successful shop in the next five years. The major challenge in his business is competition from other traders. The income he will raise will improve the standard of living of the family that depends on him.

loans.use: to buy water cans, basins, sets of dining plates, cups and cooking items.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 55 years old and married to Anthony. She supports two children, who are in school.

She has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the past nine years, and also has a shop. She has applied for her first loan from KADET, to enable her to buy fertilizer, pay for labor, and buy stock for her shop, such as sugar and rice, among other things.

With the anticipated profit, she plans to expand her farming and buy stock for her shop again. She hopes to apply for a bigger loan from KADET, to enable her increase her income in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pay for labor, and buy stock for the shop.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel, de 40 años, está casado con Johana. Ambos tienen 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Manuel se dedica a la agricultura, todas las mañanas desde muy temprano cuida de sus cultivos, en donde siembra papa, alverja y maíz; los que después de cada cosecha los comercializa en el mercado central de su localidad, pero según afirma en épocas de campaña agrícola, los mismos comerciantes visitan sus terrenos agrícola, para negociar su producción. Lo que más le gusta a Manuel, es abonar sus cultivos, para que le proporcionen buenos frutos, ya que en tiempos de lluvia necesitan mayores cuidados. Ahora él desea invertir en la compra de más terrenos agrícolas, ya dio el primer paso, comprando un pequeño terreno paralelo a su casa. Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Manuel, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Manuel is 40 years old and is married to Johana. They have 2 children who live with them in their own house.  Manuel works in agriculture and looks after his crops every morning from the early hours. He grows potatoes, peas and corn, which he sells in his local central market after the harvest. He also says that the same traders visit his farmlands during the growing season to negotiate for his crops. What Manuel likes best is fertilizing his crops so that he gets a good harvest, since in the rainy season they need more looking after. 

Now Manuel wants to buy more agricultural land and has made the first step, buying a small piece of land alongside his house. This is his fourth loan with Kiva and he is grateful for the financial support he is getting in order to make progress in life. He also promises to pay his instalments punctually. Manuel will use the 500 soles to buy organic fertilizer to feed his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is 35 years old, married, and has been blessed with three children. She runs a cereals shop in Oloitoktok town. Her spouse, John, also supports the family, by farming. Mary has been in the cereals business for three years, and her current monthly income is Kenya shillings 21,000. 

This is her second loan with KADET. She intends to use the loan to buy more stock of cereals to sell. These include maize, beans, groundnuts and rice for the shop. She will use the anticipated income to improve her business, by adding more varieties of cereal for sale.

In future Sophia hopes to buy her own plot of land, and to be able to meet her family's basic needs.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cereals to sell at her shop.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has a retail shop business in Kangundo town. He has been in this business for five years and currently makes a monthly income of Kenya Shillings 15,000. He is 36 years old and married with four children. His wife Catherine assists him in running the business.

This is his first loan and he plans to use the amount to buy more stock of goods for selling. These include rice, cooking oil, maize and wheat flour, detergents and bread. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock of items to sell.

In future, John hopes to grow his business and open a supermarket, make more income and be able to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more retail goods to sell such as rice, cooking oil, maize and wheat flour, detergents and bread

loans.name: Nelly Maria

texts.es:
Nelly tiene 61 años, una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que nunca se ha dado por vencida a pesar de la falta de oportunidades que su falta de preparación le ha generado, pues pudo prepararse hasta la secundaria sin lograr terminarla. Se casó siendo muy joven con Luis de 67 años quien trabaja por cuenta propia como comerciante, tuvieron 3 hijos que ya son adultos y cada uno ha adquirido sus propios compromisos e independencia. Nelly vive con su esposo en la ciudad de Santo Domingo el puerto terrestre que une la Región Costa y Sierra del Ecuador, por lo que la convierte en una de las ciudades más importantes del país por el alto movimiento de comercio que existe y por la producción agrícola y ganadera que se genera allí. 
Aprovechando el movimiento de turistas y comerciantes muchos de los San Domingueños han establecido sus negocios que les genere ingresos y en algunos casos generando empleo para otros. 
Nelly empezó hace 25 años con un puesto de venta de comida rápida, lo cual le resultó muy productivo y poco a poco ha ido incrementando y mejorando su negocio el cual lo atiende de lunes a domingo en horario de la tarde y noche en donde la demanda es más alta. Recibe ayuda de su esposo y además ha empezado a surtir su negocio con golosinas y artículos para dar variedad a la oferta del local el cual con el paso del tiempo se ha deteriorado y necesita algunos arreglos para lo cual solicita un préstamo con el cual pintará y arreglará el local para que esté adecuado para una atención digna de sus clientes. Hace un año atrás obtuvo un crédito de Fundación Alternativa, lo cual lo invirtió en capital de trabajo, siempre estuvo al día en sus pagos y hoy tras un año, vuelve a buscar el apoyo para que de esta forma ella pueda ganar más clientes y así sus ingresos se incrementen lo que le ayudará a mejorar su estilo de vida y tener una provisión para gastos de salud tanto de ella como su esposo ya que tiene una experiencia difícil que atravesó hace 2 años en donde su esposo cayó enfermo y los gastos fueron muy fuertes al punto de degenerar su economía. 
Nelly agradece a los inversionistas de Kiva quienes hacen posibles la realización de tantos sueños alrededor del mundo.
texts.en:
Nelly is 61-years old.  She is an enterprising and hard-working woman who never let herself get defeated by the lack of opportunities her lack of education put forth.  She was able to go to secondary school, but she didn't finish.  Nelly married Luis, who is now 67-years old, when she was very young.  Luis works separately from Nelly as a store-owner.  They had three children together who are now all grown, each with his own obligations and independence.  Nelly lives with her husband in Santo Domingo, the inland port that ties the Coastal and Mountainous Regions of Ecuador.  Santo Domingo has become one of the country's most important cities because of the high commerce traffic that exists and because of the agricultural and livestock production that is generated there.
By taking advantage of the tourist and business traffic, many of the San Domingueños have established businesses that earn them an income and, in some cases, provide employment for others.  
Nelly started her business 25 years ago selling fast food from a sales stall.  It was very productive for her and little by little she expanded and improved her business.  She works from Monday to Sunday in the evenings and at night, which is when the demand is highest.  Her husband helps her and, in addition, she has begun to stock up her business with sweets and a variety of other items to sell from her storefront.  With the passage of time, her storefront has become run-down and needs some repairs.  That is why Nelly is requesting a loan, with which she will paint and fix-up her storefront so that it is suitable for giving dignified service to her customers.  One year ago, Nelly took out a loan from Fundación Alternativa.  She invested it in working capital.  She was always up to date with her repayment schedule and now, one year later, she is returning to look for assistance so she can earn more customers and see her income increase.  This will help her to improve her standard of living and have some money saved for health concerns for herself and her husband.  They went through a difficult experience two years ago when her husband fell ill.  The costs were very high and almost ruined them financially. 
Nelly is grateful to the Kiva lenders, who make is possible for so many dreams to come true around the world.

loans.use: to paint the storefront where she sells food.

loans.name: Maria Nora

texts.es:
Maria tiene 47 años de edad, es madre de un hijo al cual quiere mucho y al que saca adelante con el fruto de su trabajo. Maria tiene una mototaxi, la cual alquila todos los días y con ello obtiene los ingresos para su hogar, ella trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes.

Maria esta muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar otra mototaxi , con la cual podrá alquilarla también y mejorar sus ingresos y poder seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hijo y viajar por el mundo”.
texts.en:
Maria is 47-years old.  She is the mother of one son, who she loves very much and who she helps to get ahead with the fruits of her labor.   Maria has a "mototaxi" (a motorcycle used to transport passengers) which she rents out every day.  Doing so, the earns the income that supports her household.  She works about nine hours a day, and she believes that business is going well for her because she is very friendly with her customers. 

Maria is very grateful for the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help they have offered her, she will be able to purchase another "mototaxi."  She will be able to rent that one out as well and improve her income.  She will also be able to keep working toward making her greatest dream a reality, "To give her son a profession and to travel the world."

loans.use: to purchase a "mototaxi" (a motorcycle used to transport passengers).

loans.name: Edwin Eduardo

texts.es:
Edwin tiene 29 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa al lado de su esposa y su hijo de 5 meses de edad. Edwin trabaja como empleado en una pequeña empresa de su ciudad, y también presta servicios de reparación de aparatos eléctricos, con lo cual tiene un dinero extra para solventar los gastos de su familia, Edwin labora alrededor de 9 horas al día , el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque con su trabajo saca adelante a su familia.

Edwin está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le están brindando el podrá realizar mejoras en la vivienda donde habita como refacción de techo y paredes, así podrá darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Edwin is 29 years old and lives in the city of Pucallpa with his wife and son of 5 months. Edwin works as an employee of a small company in his town, and also provides appliance repair services, with which he has extra money to be able to cover the expenses of the family. Edwin works around 9 hours a day. He believes that he is doing well in his job because he is responsible and overall because his work moves his family forward.

Edwin is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help that they are receiving he will be able to make improvements to his housing where he lives like roof and wall repairs, so that he will be able to give a better quality of life to his family and continue struggling to be able to make his greatest dream a reality: "To have his own house".

loans.use: to make housing improvements.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Kongowea and has had previous loans with Kiva. She repaid the loans without challenges and now she seeks another loan to buy cereals for her grocery store. She has been running the store for more than ten years and the business is doing great. 

Jane wants to own a big shop where she'll sell all kinds of food to the people. The income she will raise will pay school fees for her children and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is 29 years old, living in the Lahore area. 

Her husband owns a workshop in a nearby town. He provides dent repair and painting services for damaged vehicle bodies. He has been doing this business since 2002 and he has a good reputation in the market. He appointed a helper over his workshop to look after things and to convince the customers from outside to use the business. The number of customers has increased, due to his good attitude and impressive dealing. 

To sustain his reputation and to meet the increasing demands, Nazia's husband has urgent need of putty and paint. Her husband is a poor person. Due to household expenses, he does not have enough savings to buy the desired material for his workshop. Therefore, Nazia is trying to help her husband, in the form of a loan, so that her husband would be able to buy dent repair tools and cans of paint. 

Nazia hopes that this loan will bring positive changes to her husband's business and in the lives of her family members.

loans.use: to buy dent repair tools and cans of paint for denting services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials for making bread

loans.name: Marisela

texts.es: Marisela, de 28 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su hijo en una casa alquilada desde hace 4 años. Desde niña aprendió el oficio de la agricultura, desde ese entonces adquirió todo el conocimiento necesario para emprender está actividad. Le va bien en la siembra, pero como ella es una mujer inteligente, miró una necesidad en el pueblo, no existía una tienda de comestibles, por lo que decidió abrir una, ya tiene 3 años de experiencia y en todo este tiempo ha logrado adquirir más alimentos y surtir su negocio. “Fue difícil empezar porque al principio tenía solo lo necesario, pero poco a poco pude obtener más”, menciona Marisela, quien todos los día se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus clientes. Ahora ella desea seguir mejorando cada día más. Este es su segundo crédito con Kiva, por lo espera continuar con su apoyo financiero, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Marisela, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de arroz, azúcar y bebidas; para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Marisela is 28 years old and is a modest woman. For the last 4 years she has lived in a rented house with her son. From being a young girl she learnt about agriculture and since then has built up all the necessary knowledge to work in agriculture. She is good at growing plants but since she is an intelligent woman she spotted a need in her town- there wasn't a food store- so she decided to open one. She now has 3 years' experience and in all that time she has been able to acquire more food items and stock her business. "It was difficult to start because at the beginning I only had the basics, but gradually I was able to buy more" says Marisela, who gets up very early every morning to serve her customers. Now she wants to keep on improving all the time.

This is her second loan with Kiva so she hopes to be able to continue with her financial support. She also promises to pay her instalments punctually. Marisela will use the 1000 soles to buy rice, sugar and drinks for her food store.

loans.use: to buy food products such as rice, sugar and drinks.

loans.name: Kaitikei

texts.en:
Kaitikei is 40 years old and married to Nareyio; they both are supporting a family of ten people.  Kaitikei has been in the agriculture business for the last ten years, with a monthly income of KES 2,000. 

Kaitikei has managed to get a second loan from KADET LIMITED for KES 20,000, which will be used to purchase more cattle for fattening.

The anticipated profit will be used to buy more goats and sheep for fattening and re-selling. 

Kaitikei's hope and dream is to progress well in life with his family.

loans.use: To buy livestock for fattening and re-selling

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 33 years old, married to Anastacia, and they have four children who are in school.

He has a quarry and a transport business which he has operated for eight years. He has applied for his fifth loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him to service his motorbike and buy quarry stones for resale. He plans to buy another motorbike with the anticipated profit.

He hopes to see his children well educated in the near future.

loans.use: To service his motorbike and buy quarry stones for resale.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Don Roberto de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia  junto a su compañera de vida, el se dedica a la venta de focos, regletas, y antenas para TV desde hace varios años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en lugar muy estratégico para la venta y muy transitado por personas por lo cual posee una gran demanda,  es un hombre  responsable, honesto y muy trabajador con deseos de sacar adelante a su  familia, Roberto esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de más mercadería por mayor y así obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Don Roberto is 52 years old and lives in his own house with his life partner. He works selling light bulbs, power strips and TV antennae. For several years his business has been located in a very strategic location for sales and it is frequented by many people which is why he has a high demand. He is a responsible, honest, and very hard-working man who dreams of helping his family get ahead.

Roberto is asking for this loan to buy more merchandise in bulk and so increase his income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy light bulbs, power strips and TV anntenae in bulk.

loans.name: Ericka Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ericka del Socorro es una joven de 35 años, madre soltera, originaria del municipio de El Sauce que se gana la vida laborando como secretaria en un centro de estudios donde tiene muchos años de trabajar.
A pesar que le ha tocado criar sola a su hija sin el apoyo del padre se ha esforzado por darle lo mejor dentro de sus posibilidades y ser una buena madre.
Aun con las dificultades que le toca pasar como llevarse a su hija a su centro de trabajo por no tener quien se la cuide por falta de recursos es una mujer puntual y responsable, ya que tiene que recorrer 10 km porque su trabajo queda en las afueras del municipio.
Ericka en los últimos meses se ha sentido mal de salud por eso acudió a Ceprodel en busca de un financiamiento para compra de medicamentos, realización de ultrasonidos, pago de consultas médicas con el fin de mejorar su salud y así dar lo mejor en su trabajo, ya que gracias a esto tiene el pan de cada día.
Pide a los inversionistas de kiva que le apoyen con su solicitud a través de Ceprodel porque es una persona de escasos recursos que en este momento necesita una mano amiga.
texts.en:
Ericka del Socorro is 35 years old and a single mother.  She is originally from the town of El Sauce and has worked as a secretary at a school for many years.  Although she has had to raise her daughter without the support of her father, she has made an effort to give her the best that she could and be a good mother.  In spite of the difficulties that have happened to her, like having to bring her daughter to work with her because she couldn't pay anyone to care for her, she is a punctual and responsible woman.  She has to travel 10 kilometers to work since she lives on the outskirts of town.

In the last few months, Ericka has been in bad health, so she came to Ceprodel in search of a loan to purchase medicines, get ultrasounds, and pay for medical visits to improve to her health and be able to do her best at work, which supports her family.

She is asking the Kiva lenders to support her with the help of Ceprodel because she a person with limited resources who needs a helping hand at this moment.

loans.use: to purchase medicines, get ultrasounds, and pay for medical visits.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es: Cirila, de 58 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Raúl con quien tiene 7 hijos, pero solo vive con 6 de ellos en la casa que heredó de sus padres. Desde niña aprendió lo necesario del campo y desde entonces continua cuidando los sembríos de papa, alverja, habas y maíz, los cuales siembra en los terrenos que le dierón sus padres cuando era joven. Comenta que gracias a su buena disposición en las ventas puede comercializar con gran rapidez sus cosechas, además de ser conocida ya que posee vacas de buena calidad de las que extrae leche y los comercializa a una empresa procesadora de leche reconocida en el país. Ahora desea mejorar sus sembríos  y sus tierras ya que su mayor ambición es seguir obteniendo más ganancias para sacar a sus hijos adelante. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, por lo espera continuar con su apoyo financiero, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Cirila, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
58-year-old Cirila is a hard-working woman. She lives with her husband Raúl with whom she has 7 children, although she only lives with 6 of them in the house she inherited from her parents. From being a young girl she learnt the ways of the countryside and since then has continued to grow potatoes, peas, broad beans and corn. She sows these on the land which her parents gave her when she was young. She says that thanks to her friendly nature when making sales she is able to sell her crops very quickly. She is also well known as she has good quality cows which she milks and sells the milk to a milk processing company which is well known throughout the country. Now she wants to improve her crops and her land since her main ambition is to carry on getting more profits so she can bring her children up properly.

This is her first loan with Kiva and she hopes to be able to continue with the financial support. She promises to pay her instalments punctually. Cirila will use the 500 soles to buy organic fertilizer to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Jaime Alberto

texts.es: Jaime, con 32 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos de 11, 9 y 7 años. La idea de montar un negocio propio surgió al no encontrar oportunidades de empleo y a la difícil situación económica por la que atravesaba su familia. Por esta razón montó un restaurante donde trabaja de Lunes a Domingo en compañía de su esposa, de esta manera obtiene los recursos necesarios para solventar las necesidades y gastos básicos de su familia. Jaime es un hombre con visión y proyección hacia el cumplimiento de sus metas, siempre pensando en el bienestar de sus hijos y su esposa, quienes lo motivan día a día para seguir avanzando. Actualmente solicita el crédito con el interés de invertirlo en la compra de insumos al por mayor (granos, verduras, gaseosas, aceite, carnes, entre otros) y activos fijos (carpas para adecuar el negocio), con esto podrá mejorar la imagen del establecimiento y podrá ofrecer a sus clientes gran variedad de productos frescos y de muy buena calidad, lo que le permitirá aumentar su clientela y así mejorar la entrada de recursos económicos para su familia. Adicionalmente tendrá la oportunidad de avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su mayor sueño que es fortalecer su negocio y montar más sucursales para poder brindar oportunidades de empleo a otras personas y, de esta forma mejorar la calidad de vida tanto de su familia, como de los empleados que laboren con él.
texts.en:
Jaime is 32 years old, married, and has three children who are 11, 9, and 7 years old.  He got the idea to start his own business when he was not able to find work opportunities and his family was in a difficult financial situation.  He started a restaurant where he works from Monday to Sunday together with his wife.  This allows them to earn the necessary resources to meet their family's needs and basic expenses.  Jaime is a man with a vision for the future to achieve his goals.  He is always thinking of the well-being of his children and his wife, who motivate him to move forward every day.  

He is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients at wholesale (grains, vegetables, sodas, oil, meat, and other items) and fixed assets (canopies to adapt his business).  This will allow him to improve the image of his business and offer his customers a large variety of fresh products of good quality.  This will help him expand his customer base and therefore improve his family's financial situation.  This gives him the opportunity to advance towards the fulfillment of his greatest dream, which is to strengthen his business and open more locations so that he can provide employment opportunities to other people, and improve not only his family's quality of life but also that of the employees that work for him.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients at wholesale (grains, vegetables, soda, oil, meat, and other items) and fixed assets (canopies to adapt his business).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy utensils for her hair salon.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 22 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma, in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is currently in school. For the past 5 years, Annet has been working hard to manage her salon, where she sells hair pieces and cosmetics and provides hair dressing services. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 750,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase weaves and other hair pieces, and will help Annet to generate greater profits and to increase her capital. Annet hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business further. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: To purchase weaves and other hair pieces, to sell at her salon

loans.name: Karin Group

texts.es: La Sra. Jessica  de 39 años de edad  y madre de  2 hijos.  La Sra. Jessica se dedica hace 4 años al corte de cabello (peluquería)  en un local, la Sra. Jessica que ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes  el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde  poder tener su salón de belleza  y así obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá   en ampliar  el local y comprar más productos  (tijera, cepillo de peluquería, secadores, resuradoras, etc.) A la vez  la Sra. Jessica  y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos  con Kiva y Edaprospo por el préstamo otorgado   y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. La Sra. Jessica  se encuentra parada se le distingue con una chompa de color celeste,  despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Jessica, 39, is the mother of two children.  She has worked for four years cutting hair in her space.  She has acquired loyal customers, generating earnings to cover her household expenses.  Jessica would like to have her own space in the future so her beauty salon will earn more profit.

She'll invest the loan in expanding her space and buying more products (scissors, styling brush, dryers, shavers, etc.).

Jessica and all the members are grateful to Kiva and EDAPROSPO for the loan granted and for the trust placed in them.

Jessica's standing up and wearing a blue sweater.  She signs off promising to achieve all her objectives.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is 23 years old, married and a mother of one child. For the last three years, she has earned a living by selling clothes in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of 9,850 KES (Kenyan shillings). 

Saumu was introduced to KADET LTD by our credit officer and is applying for her second loan of 20,000 KES to buy additional stock for her business such as dresses, blouses, trousers, shirts and so on, to sell to her customers. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her child as well as expand her business. Her goal for the future is to continue growing her business so that she can help give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing for her business.

loans.name: Anonciata

texts.en:
Anonciata resides in a trading centre a few kilometres away from Ibanda town and that’s where she does her business of local brewing. Annociata is a midwife by profession and also has a pharmaceutical drug shop as a side business. She resorted to this because there were no health services within her area of residence and people suffering were moving long distances to seek medical advice. She also opted to start a drug shop with the help of a loan. 

Annonciata is hard-working and will use the loan to buy more stock of medicinal drugs which are in demand by her clients to help her serve them better. She has a heart for people.

loans.use: To buy pharmaceutical drugs.

loans.name: Oygul

texts.en:
Oygul is 51 years old. She is hardworking and a smart woman. She is a widow. She is the main breadwinner in her family and that’s why she is going to organize a new business and find a way to earn income. She studied at the course, ‘To Get Ahead’ and got a certificate. She plans to organize a business  selling office supplies. 

Oygul will sell her goods in the local market. Her children will help her with the business. She is asking for a loan of 2500 somoni to buy office supplies such as paper, pens, pen boxes, etc. From the profit she is going to improve her living conditions.  She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy office supplies as paper, pens, pen boxes, etc. for organizing a new business

loans.name: Pedro Nolazco

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 67 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Piura y trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de pescado. Pedro recorre las calles de su ciudad ofreciendo sus productos, especialmente en las mañanas ya que la mayoría de sus clientes son amas de casa, el cree que le va bien en su pequeño negocio porque ofrece pescado de calidad y con el peso exacto.

Pedro esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá realizar un mantenimiento a su pequeño vehículo de transporte ya que tiene algunas averías y de esta manera podrá tener un vehículo en buenas condiciones para transportar su producto, así seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener cámaras frigoríficas y podrá transportar su mercadería de manera directa del puerto a sus clientes
texts.en:
Pedro, 67, lives in the city of Piura and works in his small business selling fish. Pedro travels the streets of his city offering his products, especially in the mornings since the majority of his customers are housewives. He believes that his small business is going well because he offers quality fish by the exact weight.

Pedro is very appreciative of the Kiva lenders since thanks to their help that they have given he will be able to carry out maintenance on his small transport vehicle. It has some problems and in this manner he will be able to have a vehicle in good condition to transport his product. Thereby he will continue fighting to be able to make his biggest dream a reality: "To have refrigeration and be able to transport his product in a direct way to the door of his customers."

loans.use: to maintain and repair a delivery vehicle.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 19 años es una mujer alegre. Vive en compañía de su esposo y sus 2 hijos: María Elena y Anaís a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 4 años. Gracias al apoyo de su esposo, todos los día se dedica al cuidado de sus sembríos como papa y maíz en mayor cantidad, pero aprovecha este tiempo para cuidar también de sus ganado, pues posee vacas, cerdos y ovejas los cuales comercializa cuando se encuentran maduros. Comenta que la ganadería le permite mantener a su familia, ya que obtiene ingresos de manera constante, ya que la vaca le proporciona leche todos los días, esta leche los comercializa a una empresa reconocida, asimismo su esposo realiza el arado de tierra con los toros que posee y le pagan todos los días una suma considerable. Ahora desea mejorar la calidad de sus animales para poder obtener mejores ganancias de las que posee. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, por lo espera continuar con su apoyo financiero, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. María, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de comida balanceada por cantidad para nutrir a sus animales.
texts.en:
María who is 19 years old is a happy woman who lives with her husband and their 2 children, María Elena and Anaís, whom she looks after in the house which she bought 4 years ago. With the help of her husband she works every day looking after her crops, mainly potatoes and corn, but she also makes use of her time to look after her animals. She has cows, pigs and sheep which she sells when they are mature. She says the livestock helps her to support her family as it gives her a steady income. The cow provides milk every day and she sells the milk to a well-known company. Her husband also does ploughing with the bulls he has and for this he gets paid well every day. Now María wants to improve the quality of her animals so she can get better profits from the animals she has. 

This is her first loan with Kiva and she hopes that with the financial support she will be able to continue. She promises to pay her instalments punctually. María will use the 1000 soles to buy nutritious food in bulk to feed her animals.

loans.use: to buy nutritious food for her animals.

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en:
Bassam is 44 years old and a married man, who comes from a small village near Tulkarem city. He is a father for seven children, five sons and two daughters. All of them are attending schools. Bassam is a laborer outside Tulkarem. Because his ability to go to work every day is inhibited by the checkpoint between his village and where he works, his income is unstable, and he often faces daily challenges in his effort to make a living.

Bassem works also in his own farm, where he plants seasonal crops, which he sells in the local market. Bassam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more seeds and seedlings to plant in his farm. This will increase his income and improve his living conditions. Bassam appears in the photo at his farm.

loans.use: to buy more seeds and seedlings to plant in his farm

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Doña Dora de 44 años, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos  hijas, hace 30 años se dedica al negocio de venta de  tortillas, tiene mucha clientela por ser una persona muy amable a la hora de vender y por venderlas a buen precio, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Dora solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos como maíz por mayor , gas y cal para su negocio, con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: Dora is 44, lives at her own house with her husband and two daughters, for 30 years she has sold tortillas, she has many clients because she is a nice person when she is selling and because she sells them at a good price, with the profit she earns she is able to cover her home expenses, Dora requests a loan to  purchase wholesale corn, gas and lime for her business, she hopes to provide her family with a better quality of life this way.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale prices, gas and lime.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a poor but hardworking woman, aged 41, living in Lahore, Pakistan. The living standard of her house is not good. She wants to change the living standard of her family and provide them education. She always remains in tension about which types of methods and strategies she should adopt, so that she could bring about positive change in her family’s life.

Rubina's husband has only a single source of income. He is in a construction business, and Rubina wants to invest all her resources for the establishment of this business. She requested her third loan, so that she could invest more money in the current business.  She hopes that with the loan amount, her husband would be able to buy pillars and wooden boards and could get more profit.

A few days ago Rubina fell down some stairs and got an injury on her wrist; she wants to treat this injury from the profit earned using the loan amount. Rubina praises and thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy materials for her husband's construction business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 30 years old, married, and supports a family of three. 

She runs a home products wholesale business in the Kaptumo trading center. This has been her income-generating business for the last ten years. From this business, she gets an average profit of KES 30,000 a month, which has enabled her to educate her children, meet her family's financial needs, and expand her business, as well as support some of the  members of her community.

Elizabeth has borrowed a loan of KES 100,000 for a period of 14 months. With this loan, she intends to use the money to pay for the stock that had been supplied to her (e.g., ten bags of sugar, 15 bales of wheat flour, five bags of rice, among other items).


She anticipates getting more profits from the business and she intends to use them to pay fees for her children, expand her business, and help members of her extended family. Elizabeth's hope and dream is to have a successful life.

loans.use: to pay for stocks of sugar, wheat flour, rice, and other items.

loans.name: Sento

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Sento.  She is married and has four children aged 26, 23, 19 and 6 years, Two are school-going children. In 2003, Sento established her groundnut business. She began her business because her foster parent was unable to pay for her education, so she was introduced to business.  

After she got married her husband gave her some money to start a groundnut business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,090,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000.

Sento requires a loan in order to purchase bags of groundnuts. In the future, Sento plans to build another house, a store, expand the business and educate her children.  This loan will help to increase sales and profits. She is a hardworking businesswoman. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase bags of groundnuts.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Ramatu.  She is married and has six children aged 32, 30, 28, 26, 23 and 18 years. Two are school-going children. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her to be fostered.  

In 2007, Ramatu established her cosmetics business selling body cream, body lotion, powder, hair extensions, and hairnets etc. She began her business because her parents did not place value on girl-child education.  She was only introduced to business, and knowing her background, her husband gave her some money to start up a fish business which she later changed to a cosmetic business.  

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Ramatu requires a loan in order to purchase cartons of body cream, body lotion, packets of earrings, chains, and Vaseline. In the future, Ramatu plans to open another outlet, build another house, and educate her children.  This loan will help her to achieve some of her future plans. 
She is a hardworking and trustworthy businesswoman. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase cartons of body cream, body lotion, packets of earrings, chains, and Vaseline.
